enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Executive Managing Director of Sozo Ventures. Veteran venture investor and entrepreneur; emeritus Executive Chairman/CEO of the Kauffman Fellows. Lectures at Stanford and has served as a Visiting Professor at Waseda University.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of Sozo Ventures; previously co‑founded Reference Media in Tokyo, served as General Partner at JAFCO America and ran U.S. operations for Copan. From 2008–2016 he served as CEO of the Kauffman Fellows (now emeritus Executive Chairman) and has taught at Stanford and Waseda University while advising multiple VC firms and startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early to growth‑stage technology companies (advanced data technologies, enterprise software/fintech, e‑commerce, IoT, healthcare IT) with focus on supporting startups planning global expansion (notably entry into Japan).

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner and co‑founder at Bow Capital, focused on late‑seed and early Series A investing. Former product/growth and operating roles at Foursquare and Maven Clinic and prior investing roles at Bessemer and Khosla. Holds degrees in Economics and Computer Science from UC Berkeley. Based in New York and originally from the East Bay, California.
enrichment.career_background: Rafi began his career as a consultant at The Boston Consulting Group, then moved into product and growth roles (including Foursquare) before transitioning to venture investing at Bessemer Venture Partners and Khosla Ventures. He served as COO & Head of Growth at Maven Clinic and co‑founded Bow Capital in 2018, where he is a General Partner. He holds BA/BS degrees from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.investment_focus: Late seed / early Series A-stage investments in consumer internet, marketplaces, logistics/transportation, financial inclusion/insurtech and enterprise software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at 8‑Bit Capital. Serial entrepreneur and operating executive who has held CEO/COO/CFO roles (notably Friendster) and was COO at Nuzzel and Neo. Host of the Something Ventured podcast. Holds an MBA from Kellogg School of Management and the CFA designation.
enrichment.career_background: Kent Lindstrom is a Silicon Valley operator-turned-investor. He co-founded 8‑Bit Capital after serving in senior operating roles — including CEO/CFO/COO at Friendster, COO of Nuzzel, and COO of Neo (Digital Garage’s software division). He previously founded PlacePop and NetRead and worked in technology/finance practices at Deloitte. He hosts the Something Ventured podcast and holds an MBA from Northwestern (Kellogg) and a CFA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) software — focus areas include AI, cloud, cybersecurity, enterprise, fintech, and social.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and angel active in crypto/DeFi and Web3. Former Partner at ParaFi Capital and earlier worked in investment banking and growth investing. Publicly visible in the DeFi community and a participant in NFT/DAO activity.
enrichment.career_background: Santiago Roel Santos began in investment banking (financial sponsors) at J.P. Morgan, moved to growth investing at Sageview Capital, served as Director of Research & Growth at Elysium Health, and later joined ParaFi Capital as a Partner focused on crypto and DeFi. He is also identified in public sources as a founder of Inversion (a crypto/private-equity strategy) and an active angel investor in Web3 projects.
enrichment.investment_focus: DeFi and Web3 protocols, crypto infrastructure, NFTs/gaming, early-stage token and venture investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Cool Climate Collective and a movement-driven startup investor. Former Venture Partner/EIR at 500 Startups and Google for Startups; co‑founder of Storefront and SocialEarth. Listed on Forbes 30 Under 30 and active in climate tech, Web3, and startup ecosystem programs.
enrichment.career_background: Tristan co‑founded Storefront (marketplace for retail pop‑ups) and SocialEarth, and later served as a Venture Partner at 500 Startups where he helped direct accelerator and seed investments (~$30M) across 200+ startups. He has been Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Google for Startups, a Terra ClimateTech VC Fellow, and since 2021 is a Founding Partner at Cool Climate Collective, investing in early‑stage climate solutions and operating a syndicate model.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage climate tech (Pre‑seed/Seed) via syndicate/SPVs — decarbonization, materials & biotech, food/agriculture systems, circular economy, and founder/operator support for go‑to‑market and scaling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor focused on human augmentation; founder of the Human Augmentation Syndicate and co‑founder of Reveri. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area and active as a board member and early‑stage investor. citeturn0search2
enrichment.career_background: Founded and led multiple internet companies (I/PRO, Topica, TextMarks) and has served on boards including Strava, NeoSensory and Freedom Financial; co‑founder of Reveri and active angel investor. Holds a B.S. (MIT) and an MBA (Stanford). citeturn1search2
enrichment.investment_focus: Human augmentation (exoskeletons, enhanced/extra senses), wearables, brain–computer interfaces, genomics. citeturn0search5

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Turtle Ventures and a longtime marketplaces investor and operator. Co‑founder and board member of Rev; early team member at oDesk (Upwork). Former General Partner/Managing Director at Jackson Square Ventures and Venture Partner at FJ Labs. Holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering from MIT.
interests: Early-stage SaaS and marketplace-enabled consumer businesses
enrichment.career_background: Josh Breinlinger began as an engineer/consultant, was an early member of oDesk (now Upwork), co‑founded Rev, and later joined VC (Sigma/Sigma West then Jackson Square Ventures). He founded Turtle Ventures to invest in defensible marketplace/network-effect companies and has served as a Venture Partner at FJ Labs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Marketplaces and network-effect companies (early-stage seed/Series A); e-commerce and consumer marketplaces; select SaaS and proptech/real estate marketplace opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Adam Nash is co‑founder and CEO of Daffy, a consumer fintech donor‑advised fund platform. He is a longtime product executive and angel investor who previously served as President & CEO of Wealthfront and as a product leader at LinkedIn and Dropbox. Nash is an adjunct lecturer at Stanford and holds BS/MS (Computer Science) from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard.
interests: Charitable giving / philanthropy and donor‑advised funds
enrichment.career_background: Product and operations executive turned founder and investor. Nash led product at LinkedIn, was President & CEO of Wealthfront, and served as VP of Product & Growth at Dropbox before co‑founding Daffy; he also serves on boards (e.g., Acorns, Shift) and teaches personal finance at Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage/seed consumer fintech and financial services; product‑led consumer software and marketplaces; developer/tools and fintech adjacent charitable‑tech

enrichment.personal_bio: Cory Klippsten is the CEO and co‑founder of Swan Bitcoin and a managing partner at Bitcoiner Ventures. He is an angel investor and advisor who has worked at Google, McKinsey, Microsoft and Morgan Stanley and holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He is a frequent commentator on Bitcoin and lives in Los Angeles with his family.
enrichment.career_background: Klippsten is the founder and CEO of Swan Bitcoin (founded 2019) and a managing partner at Bitcoiner Ventures (partner). Prior to founding startups he held roles at Google, McKinsey, Microsoft and Morgan Stanley and earned an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He has served as an advisor to several crypto firms and as an angel investor in early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Bitcoin‑focused infrastructure and applications; early‑stage (seed) investments; marketplaces, platforms and SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and co-founder at Courtside Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on sports, gaming, fitness and media. He leads investments across sports betting, digital media and wellness and has been involved with early bets such as Beam and The Athletic. Previously a partner at Interplay Ventures and an associate at UBS; BA from University of Maryland, College Park.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Partner at Courtside Ventures (launched 2016), previously a Partner/Venture Partner at Interplay Ventures and an Associate at UBS. Founded a CRM company for professional and college sports teams and serves/has served on boards including The Athletic and 24 Hour Fitness.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) investments in sports, gaming, fitness/wellness, sports media, collectibles and consumer-focused lifestyle startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing partner and co‑founder of Presence Capital, an early‑stage VC focused on VR/AR. Serial entrepreneur — co‑founded MyMiniLife (acquired by Zynga) and Toro (acquired by Google) and co‑created FarmVille while at Zynga. Former engineer at Epic Games; holds a B.S. in Computer Science from University of Illinois Urbana‑Champaign.
enrichment.career_background: Amitt Mahajan is a technologist‑turned‑investor. He co‑founded and is managing partner at Presence Capital (founded 2015), and has founded multiple companies including MyMiniLife and Toro (both acquired). He served as Director of Engineering / CTO roles at Zynga (co‑created FarmVille) and worked as an engineer at Epic Games; he later founded Proof of Play and Rare Bits and has invested in early‑stage startups across VR/AR and adjacent spaces.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments in VR/AR and immersive technologies; immersive gaming and 3D platforms; developer tools, computer vision, and consumer social/platform software

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Mucker Capital based in Austin, Texas. Invests in pre-seed, seed, and Series A startups across the Mountain West and Southeastern U.S. Prior roles include Principal at Social Starts and Joyance Partners and Director on the Strategy & Operations team at The Advisory Board Company. Holds a BSE in Operations Research & Financial Engineering from Princeton University and an MBA from the McCombs School of Business (UT Austin).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Mucker Capital in 2020 to invest in and accelerate early-stage companies; previously spent ~3.5 years as a Principal at Social Starts and Joyance Partners focused on software investments in education, consumer and healthcare, and earlier worked in strategy & operations at The Advisory Board Company/EAB advising on revenue, product launches and M&A. Educated at Princeton (BSE) and UT Austin (MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Stages: pre-seed, seed, Series A. Sectors: healthcare (distribution/healthtech), alternative education, consumer brands, AI/ML, vertical SaaS, marketplaces. Geography focus: TX, Mountain West, Southeastern U.S.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner of HCVC / Hardware Club. Former structured‑equity professional at BNP Paribas with an EM Lyon Master in Management. Leads a community‑driven VC focused on scaling hardware and hardtech startups from early stages.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in structured equity at BNP Paribas before co‑founding Hardware Club (HCVC) to build a community and venture arm supporting hardware and hardtech founders. Serves as Founder & Managing Partner at HCVC, co‑founded Elephants & Ventures, and has been active in founding/mentoring initiatives (Hello Tomorrow / Techstars) and board roles for portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage hardtech/hardware (pre‑seed to Series A); sectors include robotics, AI infrastructure, climate/energy, space, defense and tech‑bio.

enrichment.personal_bio: Matt Mullenweg is the co‑founder of WordPress and founder & CEO of Automattic. He is the founder/principal of Audrey Capital, an angel investment and research company, and an active early‑stage investor focused on web and open‑source projects. He is also an avid photographer and public speaker.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑creator of WordPress (2003) and founder of Automattic (2005), Mullenweg has led Automattic as CEO while investing and advising through Audrey Capital. He has served on boards (including GitLab) and has backed a range of developer‑focused and consumer internet companies, maintaining a public profile around open source, distributed work, and web infrastructure.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage angel investments in open‑source software, web publishing, developer tools, web infrastructure, and consumer internet platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at First Star Ventures and a technologist-investor based in the Boston/Cambridge area. Focuses on early-stage "hard" tech — AI/ML, decentralization/web3, edge/sensors and computational biotech. Former product/engineering lead at Semantic Machines, Locately (co‑founder/CTO) and Endeca. Holds an AB in Computer Science from Harvard University.
enrichment.career_background: Drew Volpe is a technologist, entrepreneur and investor. He co-founded and is Founding Partner of First Star Ventures (focused on pre-seed/seed deep‑tech investments). Previously he was founding VP of Product Development at Semantic Machines, co‑founder/CTO of Locately, and Director of Product Development at Endeca (acquired by Oracle). He holds an AB in Computer Science from Harvard University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed; deep tech (AI/ML, decentralization/web3, edge/sensors); computational biotechnology / techbio; cloud & infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor, entrepreneur, and author focused on the intersection of exponential technologies and decentralized networks. Founder and Managing Partner of Network Society Ventures and founder/trustee of Network Society Research. Active in Web3/blockchain since 2010 and involved in AI, longevity, and the future of work.
enrichment.career_background: David Orban is founder and Managing Partner of Network Society Ventures (since 2015), founder/trustee of Network Society Research and Network Society Lab, CEO of Actioneer, faculty/advisor at Singularity University, and a mentor for the Thiel Fellowship. He studied physics in Italy and has founded and led multiple technology startups while advising and investing in early-stage companies across AI, Web3 and other exponential-tech sectors.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments at the intersection of exponential technologies and decentralized networks (AI, Web3/crypto); sectors include energy, manufacturing, healthcare, education, and finance.

enrichment.firm_name: Fab Co-Creation Studio Ventures (aka Fab Ventures)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of Fab Co-Creation Studio Ventures (Fab Ventures), a seed-stage fund focused on conscious beauty, sustainable fashion and DTC consumer brands. Former CEO/President of Lancôme (L'Oréal) and former Chief Strategy & Data Officer at Orange. Based in Los Angeles, California; founder of the FaB Fashion & BeautyTech community and active as an angel investor and board advisor.
enrichment.career_background: 30+ year career across luxury, beauty and telecom: held senior marketing and P&L roles at Chanel/Yves Saint Laurent and L’Oréal (including CEO/President of Lancôme International), served as Chief Strategy & Data Officer at Orange, then transitioned to angel investing and founded the FaB community and Fab Co-Creation Studio Ventures; serves on multiple boards and advises startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed investments in direct-to-consumer consumer brands and platforms — primarily conscious beauty, sustainable fashion, new commerce and retail tech (U.S.-focused).

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial technology entrepreneur and angel investor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Founder of Archimedes (Archimedes Labs/Archimedes Accelerator), founding shareholder of TechCrunch, and founder & CEO of SignalRank. Has advised and invested in early-stage software and platform companies globally.
enrichment.career_background: Keith Teare is a long-time Silicon Valley entrepreneur and investor. He founded Archimedes (an incubator/accelerator), co-founded or led multiple companies including RealNames and Cyberia, was a founding shareholder of TechCrunch, served senior roles at Accelerated Digital Ventures, and currently leads SignalRank. His activity spans founding, advising, and early-stage investing with a focus on software platforms and emerging tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and seed investments in software/platform companies; interests in AI, blockchain/web3 and platform-enabled consumer/enterprise startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Andrew Tan is a San Francisco–based entrepreneur and early-stage investor. He is founder of Nova (acquired) and a general partner at Builders (Builders VC). Tan has held AI/product and data roles at Handshake, Google, and Sequoia and writes newsletters on AI and founders.
enrichment.career_background: Founder of Nova (acquired); founder of Builders Capital (Builders syndicate) and active angel investor. Prior roles include leading generative AI/product at Handshake and data science/product roles at Sequoia and Google; involved in writing and curating AI-focused newsletters and operating/venture roles since 2018.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed–Series A); AI / generative AI, enterprise SaaS, developer tools, fintech, deep tech

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Partech (joined 2019) and founding partner of Irregular Expressions. Former CTO and engineering leader at startups including Cadre, Fountain, One Kings Lane and Mint. Focuses on early-stage investments in developer-focused infrastructure and tooling.
enrichment.career_background: Engineer-turned-investor with 20+ years in technical leadership. Held VP/CTO roles at Mint, One Kings Lane, Fountain and Cadre; earlier engineering roles at Motorola and Oracle. Began angel/advising activity in 2012, founded the Irregular Expressions syndicate in 2018 and joined Partech's venture team in 2019. Holds an M.S. in Computer Science from Telecom Paris (Télécom ParisTech).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed / Series A) technology startups, primarily business-to-developer tools: developer tooling, infrastructure, observability, ML/MLOps, data infrastructure, security; selective fintech and SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Emergence Capital since 2010. Led Emergence's early investment in Zoom and serves on several public and private company boards. Former founder of AXG Tecnonexo and holds an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Emergence in 2010 and was later promoted to General Partner; has led/partnered on investments including Zoom, Chorus.ai and Crunchbase. Prior to VC he founded AXG Tecnonexo, a SaaS e-learning company operating across Latin America and the U.S. He is a Kauffman Fellow and Endeavor Entrepreneur and holds a BS in economics from Universidad de San Andrés and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Cloud and enterprise SaaS (B2B software), enterprise/go-to-market applications, digital media

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at The Refiners, a San Francisco‑based seed fund and accelerator. Repeat entrepreneur originally from France (founder/CEO roles at Emakina/Reflect, blueKiwi, Kwarter) and founder/CEO of Uncut.fm; host of the Silicon Carne podcast. Active in pre‑seed/seed investing and mentoring international founders.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur who founded Reflect (Emakina), blueKiwi (sold to ATOS), and Kwarter; co‑founded The Refiners (2016) to run a Silicon Valley accelerator for foreign founders and later launched Diaspora Ventures (rolling fund) and Uncut.fm. Based in San Francisco after moving from France; serves as investor, mentor and advisor to early‑stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage; sector‑agnostic with emphasis on cross‑border/international founders, B2B and B2C startups (SaaS, marketplaces, consumer products), and early creator‑economy/web3 opportunities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Ravelin Capital, an early‑stage firm focused on software for critical industries. Previously an investor at Village Global and co‑founder of earlier investment vehicles; studied at the University of Minnesota. Born and raised in Brazil and later immigrated to the U.S.
enrichment.career_background: Lucas Vaz is the founder and general partner of Ravelin Capital (founded 2023), an early‑stage VC backing software‑defined companies in "Critical Industries." Before Ravelin he invested at Village Global and co‑founded prior investment initiatives; he graduated from the University of Minnesota (Carlson School of Management).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in "Critical Industries" — software for industrials, manufacturing, defense, aerospace, energy, and other mission‑critical sectors.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment manager at DG Incubation (DG Ventures) based in Tokyo and founder/CEO of Off Topic, a podcast and newsletter about US tech and internet culture. Graduated from Babson College. Focuses on early-stage deals and US–Japan market localization, especially DTC, retail infrastructure and creator-economy software.
interests: US–Japan market localization and cross-border expansion
Web3 / digital-native content and virtual humans
enrichment.career_background: Has worked as an investment manager at DG Incubation (DG Ventures) and supported portfolio companies as a board observer. Founded Off Topic (podcast/newsletter) and has contributed to tech media; background includes startup operations and business development. Educated at Babson College (B.B.A.).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments across DTC/retail infrastructure, creator-economy software, consumer internet/marketplaces, and AI-enabled services; supports US–Japan localization.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Co‑founder and CEO of Autograph and co‑founder/former CEO of AbstractOps. General Partner / active angel with Autopilot Fund; focuses on products that automate work and serve as systems of record. Holds degrees from Northwestern University and Stanford University.
interests: People / HR tech and headcount tooling
enrichment.career_background: Started in management consulting (BCG), then joined the founding team and served as COO at Forge (Equidate). Co‑founded AbstractOps (CEO), became an active angel and General Partner at Autopilot Fund, and is currently co‑founder & CEO of Autograph, a people‑intelligence / HR platform. Educated at Northwestern (BA) and Stanford (MS).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed, occasionally Series A) enterprise SaaS: systems-of-record & data platforms, workflow automation / 'API for X' products, people/HR tech, and marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at RareBreed Ventures who focuses on very early-stage startups. Previously worked at Spero Ventures and Andreessen Horowitz and has co-founded startups (RepresentYou, Semantiks) and advised companies including Para. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Jonathan Kroll is a venture investor and operator. He serves as Venture Partner at RareBreed Ventures (since ~2020), previously worked as an investor at Spero Ventures and in market development at Andreessen Horowitz, and co‑founded/served as CTO at early startups (RepresentYou, Target Test Prep) and later startups (Semantiks). He has advised companies such as Para and is active in pre-seed/seed ecosystems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups — primarily fintech, AI, marketplaces and consumer internet (also Web3/crypto); emphasis on founders outside major tech hubs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at Proteum Capital focused on blockchain/Web3 and digital-asset strategy. Board advisor and ecosystem builder involved with companies in advanced manufacturing and web3 products; co‑founder of The NFT Brewery/DataCurve. Education includes an MBA from Carnegie Mellon and engineering degrees from IIT‑BHU and UIC.
enrichment.career_background: Amanjyot S. Johar has worked in investment strategy and venture roles since the 2000s, serving as Principal for investment strategy at Proteum (since ~2017). He has held board and advisor roles (e.g., Sakuu, KeraCel, IIFX), co‑founded ventures including The NFT Brewery/DataCurve and QuikR, and holds an MBA from Carnegie Mellon (Tepper) plus technical degrees from IIT‑BHU and University of Illinois Chicago.
enrichment.investment_focus: Blockchain / Web3, digital assets & tokenization, FinTech & payments, media & entertainment, enterprise software & IoT — typically seed to early growth (seed–Series A).

enrichment.personal_bio: Clinical psychologist and entrepreneur who served as an Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Trinity Ventures. Founding team member at Omada Health, founder/CEO of Maximus, and an Assistant Clinical Professor at UCSF. Advises and angel‑invests in early‑stage health and consumer startups.
enrichment.career_background: Trained as a clinical psychologist (BA Harvard; PhD UCLA) who moved into health‑tech entrepreneurship and venture investing. He was a founding clinical leader at Omada Health, founded Actualize, served as Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Trinity Ventures (2018), has advised VCs and startups, and is the founder and CEO of Maximus while holding a part‑time clinical professor role at UCSF.
enrichment.investment_focus: Health tech and consumer health (digital therapeutics, telemedicine, consumer wellness); consumer & enterprise software; typical stages: pre‑seed/seed to Series A (angel and co‑investments).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner and co‑founder of Adapt Ventures, an early‑stage VC and venture studio. Previously on the investment team at Plug and Play Ventures; focuses on transformative solutions across legacy industries (financial services, industrials, real estate). Named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital). Educated at New York University (BS) and Imperial College London (MSc).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Adapt Ventures (since 2020). Prior experience on the investment team at Plug and Play Ventures. Holds a corporate strategy / director role at GK (corporate group) and serves as board observer/advisor roles for select portfolio companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) investments in fintech, B2B SaaS, consumer, marketplaces, real estate and industrials; global mandate with emphasis on the US, Latin America and MENA.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at First Round Capital focused on early-stage, technical founders. Previously led sales and customer success organizations at Stripe and Mixpanel and held roles at Bain and in baseball operations. Holds a BA from Princeton and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Meka began in player development and baseball operations with the Cleveland Indians, then worked as a case team leader at Bain. He joined Stripe in a series of early sales and leadership roles, later served as Head of Sales & Customer Success for Stripe’s Startup/SMB business, and was VP of Sales & Services at Mixpanel before joining First Round as a Partner in 2021, where he focuses on helping technical founders build repeatable go-to-market motion.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) B2B/SaaS and FinTech with emphasis on go-to-market/product-market-fit; also active in hardware/space and govtech investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on the consumer investing team at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), focused on AI and consumer apps. Previously an early-stage investor at CRV and an analyst on Goldman Sachs’ Alternative Investments & Manager Selection team. Stanford BA (Economics) and Stanford GSB MBA; co‑founder of the Accelerated newsletter and co‑creator of Cardinal Ventures at Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Andreessen Horowitz as a partner on the consumer/AI investing team (role from 2021). Prior to a16z she invested at CRV (2017–2021) and began her career at Goldman Sachs; while at Stanford she co‑founded the on‑campus incubator Cardinal Ventures and later co‑founded the Accelerated newsletter/community.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & consumer AI; marketplaces; creator tools; SMB software and automation; early-stage (seed/Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on seed-stage startups in the MENA region and diaspora. Founding GP/Managing Partner for 500 Falcons (500 Startups' MENA fund); former Partner Lead to VCs & Startups at Google and ex-AdMob executive. Co-founded Plus Venture Capital and later served as CEO of Dubai Future District Fund.
interests: mentorship / bridging MENA and Silicon Valley
enrichment.career_background: Sharif El-Badawi is a technologist-turned-investor who led performance advertising at AdMob (acquired by Google) and then served as Partner Lead to VCs and startups at Google. He joined 500 Startups to run 500 Falcons (the firm’s MENA fund), co-founded Plus Venture Capital (+VC), and later became CEO of the Dubai Future District Fund. He holds an MBA from UC Irvine and a BS in Neuroscience from UCLA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in the MENA region and MENA diaspora; fintech, marketplaces, SaaS, consumer internet, adtech/mobile advertising

enrichment.personal_bio: Product leader and angel investor focused on fintech and crypto. Listed as a Venture Partner / Limited Partner at rali_cap and author of the Cryptechie newsletter. Former product roles at Coinbase and Venmo and founder of MyMBACircle.
enrichment.career_background: Operator-turned-angel: product leadership roles at Coinbase and Venmo, prior consulting at BCG, founder of MyMBACircle, author of Cryptechie, and listed as a Venture Partner / Limited Partner at rali_cap; active angel investor in fintech and blockchain startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed B2B / API-first fintech and fintech infrastructure in emerging markets (Africa, Latin America, South Asia); early-stage fintech / developer-finance startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Team Ignite Ventures; former product and AI leader at AWS and Microsoft. Holds a Finance degree from University of Washington and an MBA from UC Berkeley. Based in Northern California and hosts the Ignite Podcast.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Team Ignite in 2020 and leads the firm’s rolling/YC-focused investing strategy. Previously led AI and marketplace initiatives at Amazon Web Services (including work on SageMaker/AWS Marketplace) and held product leadership roles at Microsoft and several startups. Education: BA (University of Washington), MBA (UC Berkeley Haas).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed (YC-focused) rolling fund investing in AI/ML, B2B SaaS, fintech, marketplaces with hands-on go-to-market support.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Reforge and growth-focused angel investor; advisor to Long Journey Ventures. Former VP of Growth at HubSpot, he writes and teaches on product-led growth and growth strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Founder and CEO of Reforge (since 2016). Previously VP of Growth at HubSpot (2014–2016), Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Trinity Ventures, and co‑founder of startups including Viximo and Boundless. Active advisor and angel investor to early‑stage companies, focusing on product and growth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage startups (pre‑seed, seed, Series A); SaaS, marketplaces, networks, consumer internet, AI, and product‑led business models

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and investor; co‑founder and CEO of Collective and co‑founder of AddThis (acquired by Oracle). Founding partner and current Venture Partner at Expa, where he helped build the studios early-stage investing program. Active angel/advisor to multiple consumer and infrastructure startups.
interests: Early-stage startup building & venture studio model
Products and platforms for founders / solopreneurs (back-office, fintech)
enrichment.career_background: Hooman Radfar studied computer science and economics (University of Pennsylvania) and earned an M.S. from Carnegie Mellon. He co-founded Clearspring/AddThis and later joined Expa (initially as EIR and then a founding/venture partner) to lead early investing and studio projects. He founded 10e9 as a personal investment/advising platform and in 2020 co‑founded Collective, where he serves as CEO, focusing on back‑office financial services for self‑employed professionals.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed stage startups; venture-studio company building; fintech and financial services for small businesses; marketplaces, logistics, consumer and B2B SaaS

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder, chairman, and CEO of Altimeter Capital, a technology‑focused investment firm that manages public and private portfolios. Investor and hedge‑fund manager with prior experience as a securities lawyer, a founding principal at General Catalyst, and a portfolio manager at PAR Capital. Co‑hosts the BG2Pod podcast on tech, markets and capitalism.
enrichment.career_background: Bradley Gerstner trained as a securities lawyer (JD) and later earned an MBA from Harvard Business School. He was a founding principal at General Catalyst, worked at travel startups, served as a portfolio manager at PAR Capital, and in 2008 founded Altimeter Capital, where he remains CEO and lead investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology investments across public and private markets, with emphasis on enterprise software, marketplaces, growth‑stage technology and AI/data infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Graypes GmbH, a Swiss company that builds AI-driven tools for startup valuation and funding. Based in Switzerland, he focuses on applying algorithms and machine learning to accelerate business evaluation and matchmaking between startups and investors. Public-facing roles include speaking and podcast appearances about product and fundraising processes.
enrichment.career_background: Technology executive and entrepreneur with decades of product and engineering experience. Founder and CEO (Founder & Chairman) of Graypes GmbH; prior roles and advisory positions reported include CTO at Gameyola and advisor roles at research/technology organizations (e.g., CERTH). Educated in engineering (University of Patras reported). Active in product development, startup evaluation, and investor matchmaking.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology startups — AI/ML, SaaS, Fintech, EdTech, EnergyTech; startup valuation and funding facilitation using algorithmic/AI evaluation tools.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Blue Bear Ventures (BBV) focused on seed investments in deep tech emerging from research universities. Startup director/mentor at UC Berkeley Haas and active mentor in Silicon Valley accelerators. Formerly worked in venture roles at Propel and Hercules and in multiple medical startups (one exit with Cepheid). Holds a BS (Virginia Tech), MS (Virginia Commonwealth University) and an MBA (University of Chicago Booth).
enrichment.career_background: 10+ years in venture investing and startup operations. Co‑founder/partner at Blue Bear Ventures (seed fund for deep tech), startup director and lecturer/advisor at UC Berkeley Haas, prior roles at Propel Venture Partners and Hercules Capital, and operational roles at several medical startups including an exit with Cepheid.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre-seed investments in applied biology, sustainable-economy (climate/energy) and emerging deep technology spun out of research universities

enrichment.personal_bio: Auren Hoffman is a General Partner at Flex Capital and a serial entrepreneur focused on data and software. He co-founded Rapleaf/LiveRamp and SafeGraph, has been an active angel investor (100+ investments), and hosts the World of DaaS podcast. He holds a BS from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Hoffman is a serial founder and investor: he co-founded Rapleaf (and LiveRamp), later co-founded SafeGraph, and serves as a General Partner at Flex Capital. He has led and advised multiple startups, is an active angel investor with 100+ personal investments, and is known for public writing and podcasting on data topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage software (Seed–Series B); data & location data, SaaS, developer tools, advertising/marketing tech, AI/ML, marketplaces, fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Managing Director Emeritus at Storm Ventures, an early-stage B2B venture firm focused on Mobile, SaaS and Cloud. Previously spent 21 years in networking and computing (ROLM, IBM, Stratacom, Cisco) and was on the founding team at Stratacom. Holds a BSEE from Stanford University and an MBA from Santa Clara University. Born in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Director Emeritus at Storm Ventures with a focus on early-stage enterprise software and infrastructure. Prior roles include 21 years across ROLM, IBM, Stratacom (founding team) and senior leadership at Cisco; served as CEO/Chair at Sanera Systems and has held board/advisor roles at companies including Airespace, McData, Logikcull, Rafter and Restorando. Education: BSEE, Stanford; MBA, Santa Clara University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B (SaaS, enterprise infrastructure, cybersecurity, cloud/AI) — seed through Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Divvy Homes and former early-stage investor at DFJ. Previously led product and financing at Square and worked in private equity (TPG) and investment banking. Holds a BS from Cornell and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
enrichment.career_background: Adena Hefets is co-founder and CEO of Divvy Homes (founded 2017). She was an early-stage fintech investor at DFJ (2016–2017), before which she worked on Square Capital (product & financing), was a private equity associate at TPG and began her career in investment banking. She holds a B.S. from Cornell and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and fintech investments; later work focused on proptech and consumer finance

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner & CEO of Blockchain Coinvestors and co‑founder of Fifth Era and Keiretsu. Longtime strategy consultant and former Gap executive who now focuses on blockchain, tokenization and early‑stage investing. Author and frequent industry speaker.
enrichment.career_background: Matthew Le Merle spent ~21 years as a strategy and operations advisor at firms including McKinsey, A.T. Kearney, Monitor Group and Booz; later served as SVP of strategy and corporate development at Gap. He co‑founded Fifth Era and Keiretsu, and is Managing Partner & CEO of Blockchain Coinvestors; he has held chair/advisory roles at multiple blockchain and fintech companies and is a published author on innovation and investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Blockchain & crypto (fund‑of‑funds and token investments); early‑stage venture and seed/Series A; fintech and tokenization/security‑token infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Faye Sahai is Managing Director at Vinaj Ventures and Founding Managing Partner of Telosity, a fund that invests in digital wellness and youth mental-health startups. She focuses on early-stage digital health and behavioral-health companies. Sahai previously led innovation and investment programs at Kaiser Permanente, AIG, Blue Shield of California and Schwab.
enrichment.career_background: Sahai is an innovation leader and investor with 20+ years in healthcare, insurance, financial services and consulting. She launched and managed corporate innovation labs and funds (Kaiser Permanente, AIG), held senior roles at Blue Shield and Schwab, worked at Deloitte Consulting, co-founded startups, and now manages Telosity by Vinaj Ventures while serving on several advisory boards. She holds an MBA from UCLA Anderson and a BA from Claremont McKenna College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital wellness and behavioral/mental-health startups (pre-seed to Seed/Series A), primarily North America, with emphasis on youth mental health and scalable, evidence-informed solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial founder, product leader, and early-stage investor. Co‑founded Mexican.vc and Drone.VC; founded PBworks and Hacker Dojo. Former product manager at Google and Facebook and founder/CEO of Medcorder. Stanford BS in Computer Science.
enrichment.career_background: David Weekly is a serial entrepreneur and angel investor who has founded multiple startups and venture vehicles (PBworks, Hacker Dojo, Medcorder, Drone.VC, Mexican.vc). He has held product leadership roles at Google and Facebook, has served as a mentor to accelerator programs, and has invested in and advised early‑stage hardware and software companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage internet/software and hardware startups targeting the Mexican/Latin American market; lightweight, scalable software and early hardware (drones/robotics) plays.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Partner at Switch Ventures, based in San Francisco. Former early executive at AppDirect and ex-consultant at McKinsey & Company. Focuses on seed and early-stage investments and partnering closely with founders.
enrichment.career_background: Paul Arnold previously worked as a consultant at McKinsey & Company and was an early senior executive at AppDirect (head of business operations). He founded Switch Ventures and serves as Founder & Partner, investing primarily at seed and early stages. Education listed in public profiles includes a J.D. from the University of Michigan Law School and a B.S. from the University of Utah.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments across consumer, marketplaces, fintech, healthtech and B2B SaaS.

enrichment.personal_bio: Independent angel investor and operator. Former partner on the deal team at Andreessen Horowitz and later led startup/VC partnerships roles at Google and YouTube. As of 2024–2025 has worked on startup/API partnerships at OpenAI. Active in seed/pre-seed angel activity in tech sectors including Web3 and developer platforms.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in finance and product roles early in his career (including UBS and Proclivity), joined Andreessen Horowitz as a partner on the deal team (circa 2015–2018), then held startup/VC partnership roles at Google Cloud and product/Chief of Staff roles at YouTube (2018–2024). In 2024 moved to a startups/API-focused role at OpenAI and invests independently at the angel/seed stage.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel / seed-stage investments focused on AI and developer platforms, Web3/crypto, marketplaces and consumer products, enterprise SaaS and cloud infrastructure, and AR/VR.

enrichment.personal_bio: Builder and seed-stage investor based in New York City. Co‑founder of Workstreamer (acquired 2009) and Heights Media; has held roles building capital networks including Director of On Deck Angels. Partner at Intangible Ventures and active angel investor and advisor.
enrichment.career_background: Sam Huleatt is a founder-turned-investor with an MBA from Johns Hopkins and a BA from Bates College. He co‑founded Workstreamer and Heights Media, served as Director for On Deck Angels & Fund Team (2021–2023), was an EIR at Primary Venture Partners, and is a partner at Intangible Ventures, advising and investing in early-stage startups and capital-network initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage early investments; hands-on operator support for founders; sectors include B2B SaaS, marketplaces, fintech, adtech and consumer/health-adjacent startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Alloy Fund and co‑founder & CEO of Magna. Former co‑founder of Synapse (acquired) and product lead at Palantir; holds a BS in Computer Science & Engineering from MIT. Based in San Francisco / New York area.
enrichment.career_background: Bruno Faviero is an MIT‑trained technologist and early‑stage investor. He co‑founded Synapse (later acquired), led product at Palantir, founded startups including Maple and Magna, and is a founding partner at Alloy Fund and a former partner at Graduate Fund. He writes occasional angel checks and focuses on pre‑seed/seed operator investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed / seed) investments in AI, Web3/crypto, SaaS and enterprise software, fintech, govtech, and biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Rui Ma is an angel and early-stage investor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. She served as Greater China Partner at 500 Startups and was a Venture Partner at Synaptic Ventures (2020–2021). She founded Tech Buzz China and has a background in investment banking and cross-border investing.
enrichment.career_background: Rui Ma has worked in investment banking and investing (Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley, The Raine Group), served as Greater China Partner at 500 Startups, founded Tech Buzz China, led the nonprofit Rookie.Fund, and held venture partner roles including at Synaptic Ventures (2020–2021). She is based in the San Francisco Bay Area and has operated across the US and Greater China.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage companies in psychedelic medicines and related life-sciences, and early-stage technology companies preparing for North American capital markets.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of Canal (ShopCanal Inc.), a distributed commerce/ecommerce marketplace platform. Former Consumer Investment Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (2017–2021). Based in San Francisco and focused on consumer software, marketplaces and commerce infrastructure.
enrichment.career_background: Co-founded Canal in 2021 and has served as its CEO. Prior to founding Canal he was a consumer investor/partner at Andreessen Horowitz (2017–2021). Earlier roles include business development at Omniata and Heighten, fixed-income work at Jefferies, and finance/macroeconomic strategy at the Government Development Bank for Puerto Rico. Education includes a B.A. from Yale University and graduate study at the National University of Singapore.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & marketplace startups; ecommerce and DTC brand distribution; commerce infrastructure/platforms; typically early-stage (seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and advisor based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Member of Sand Hill Angels since 2017 with a background as a marketing and strategy executive. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a B.Sc. from the University of Toronto. Active as an advisor to early-stage technology companies and a volunteer high‑school CS teacher.
enrichment.career_background: Over a multi‑decade career he has held senior roles at McKinsey (Senior Engagement Manager), Accenture (Managing Partner), McCaw Cellular (CMO) and NextWave (SVP Sales & Marketing), served as CEO/founder of several startups (e.g., Wifi.com, Trust.MD, Wavespot), and more recently acts as an investor/advisor to startups and organizations such as Barcelona Ventures and AlphaICs.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage and early-stage technology companies (telecom/wireless, SaaS/enterprise software, healthcare & medical devices); active in marketing/GT M and product-led growth areas.

enrichment.personal_bio: Head of Bloomberg Beta, an early‑stage VC backed by Bloomberg L.P., Roy Bahat leads investments focused on the future of work and machine intelligence. He teaches at UC Berkeley’s Haas School of Business and blogs on work and career topics. Previously he served in New York City government and held executive roles in media and startups.
enrichment.career_background: Roy Bahat has led Bloomberg Beta since its 2013 launch. Before that he held senior roles in government (senior policy director in New York City), media (president of IGN Entertainment, News Corp.), and founded/chairman roles at consumer startup OUYA. He is a lecturer at UC Berkeley’s Haas School of Business and a Rhodes Scholar from Oxford (undergraduate at Harvard).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments focused on the future of work, machine intelligence/AI, developer tools, productivity and HR/EdTech for businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and longtime leader of Backstage Capital, a VC firm she launched in 2015 to back underestimated founders. Built the firm while experiencing homelessness and has focused on investing in women, people of color, and LGBTQ founders. Author of It's About Damn Time and host of the podcast 'Your First Million.'
enrichment.career_background: Worked in the music and live-production industries before teaching herself venture investing and founding Backstage Capital in 2015. Under her leadership Backstage deployed capital into a large portfolio of underrepresented founders, launched accelerator programs, ran crowdfunding initiatives for the firm, and published a book (It's About Damn Time). In 2024 she announced a transition to a chair/advisory role while continuing public-facing programming and fundraising efforts.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in companies founded by women, people of color, and LGBTQ entrepreneurs; consumer and tech-enabled startups; accelerator & mission-driven programs

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Managing Partner of Plexo Capital, an investor that backs emerging seed-stage VC funds (particularly led by diverse GPs) and makes direct early-stage investments. Incubated Plexo inside GV (Google Ventures) and spun it out in 2018. Former investing and operating leader with roles at GV, Comcast Ventures (Catalyst Fund), Zynga and senior roles at eBay and Nike. Holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and a BS from Hampton University.
enrichment.career_background: Lo Toney incubated and spun out Plexo Capital from GV and serves as its founding managing partner. Prior to Plexo he was a partner at GV, led Comcast Ventures Catalyst Fund, served as GM for Zynga (Zynga Poker), and held senior product/GM roles at Nike and eBay. He has also been a founder/CEO (LearnStreet) and worked in consulting and corporate development; he holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and a BS from Hampton University.
enrichment.investment_focus: LP investments into emerging seed-stage venture funds (focus on diverse GPs) and direct early-stage startup investments; sectors include marketplaces, consumer internet, fintech/payments, gaming/e-sports, enterprise software and infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Silicon Valley–based serial entrepreneur and investor (MIT MBA). Co‑founder/CEO of Evensi (acquired) and founder of multiple tech startups; active as a GP and fund manager. Focuses on creator economy, media/ music tech and Web3-related opportunities.
enrichment.career_background: Paolo Privitera is a serial founder and operator with over two decades in internet and media businesses. He co‑founded and led Evensi (event discovery platform) and earlier startups including Pick1, Digitix and Mestre; after Evensi's acquisition he served in corporate development at Events.com. He is a General Partner at ME Ventures and a fund manager/partner at 1521 Ventures, and serves as advisor/mentor to multiple accelerators and startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in the creator economy: music & media technology, creator tools/platforms, Web3/blockchain for creators, fintech and distribution for creative industries

enrichment.personal_bio: Ron Conway is the founder and a managing partner of SV Angel and a long-time Silicon Valley angel investor. Active since the mid-1990s, he has backed numerous early-stage technology companies, including early stakes in Google, Facebook and Airbnb. He is also known for civic engagement and philanthropy, including work on immigration reform and health-care giving.
interests: Civic engagement and public policy (e.g., immigration reform)
Diversity and economic inclusion for founders of color
enrichment.career_background: Conway worked in marketing at National Semiconductor (1973–1979), co‑founded and served as president/CEO of Altos Computer Systems (1979–1990) and later led Personal Training Systems (1991–1995). enrichment.personal_bio: Geoff Yang is a co‑founder and partner emeritus of Redpoint Ventures. He has invested across consumer media, digital content and network infrastructure and serves on several public and private boards. He holds a BSE from Princeton and an MBA from Stanford.

Discovery and multiple Redpoint portfolio companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Ventures who leads the Bay Area offices and focuses on early-stage application software and SaaS. Named to the Forbes Midas List (2012, 2013). Holds a BS in electrical engineering from Stanford and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
interests: Big data / machine learning for business apps
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bain Capital Ventures in 2003 and is a partner focused on seed and early-stage application software investing. enrichment.personal_bio: Seasoned founder and operator turned VC; joined Redpoint in 2017 and is a Managing Director focused on early-stage enterprise software. Previously co‑founded multiple enterprise startups, served as EVP & GM of ServiceCloud at Salesforce, and was CEO of Campaign Monitor.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded four enterprise software companies (three acquired, including Assistly which was acquired by Salesforce). enrichment.career_background: Stanford graduate (BS Symbolic Systems). Worked as a product hire at Cometeer, served as a scout for Sequoia and other early-stage funds, and has held investing/fellow roles at True Ventures; has participated in angel/pre-seed investments (e.g., TuMeke, Marriage Pact).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and General Partner at AngelPad who invests in and mentors early-stage technology startups. Former Google product leader and co-author of patents related to search and advertising. Based in San Francisco.
