enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A investments in consumer and enterprise technology, marketplaces, fintech, proptech, and developer/platform companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and angel investor best known for co-founding GroupMe and Fundera. Co-founder/partner at Magellan where he helped build companies and seed investments; later listed as a venture partner at Union Square Ventures. Based in Brooklyn, NY.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded GroupMe (launched 2010, acquired 2011) and later founded Fundera (launched 2013/2014, acquired by NerdWallet in 2020). Has been an active angel investor and operator, served on Splice’s board, and was a principal at Magellan (magellan.ventures) building companies and making early investments; holds a BA from Columbia University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage / seed investments; fintech and small‑business finance; consumer marketplaces and social apps; developer tools and creator/music technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of DoNotPay and solo General Partner of Browder Capital. Active angel and seed investor who backs early-stage technology startups, often focusing on young founders and technical founders. Thiel Fellow and Stanford alumnus (attended).
enrichment.career_background: Started DoNotPay in 2015 and has served as its CEO since; left Stanford to take a Thiel Fellowship. Worked as an EIR/intern at Greylock (2017–2018) and launched Browder Capital (2020) as his primary investment vehicle; has made dozens of pre-seed and seed investments across consumer and enterprise software.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed / Early-stage technology startups — AI, SaaS, developer tools, fintech and consumer/enterprise software

enrichment.personal_bio: Jyri Engeström is an entrepreneur‑turned‑investor who co‑founded Jaiku and Ditto. He is a co‑founder and partner at Yes VC and an early investor in companies including Unity, Ōura and ICEYE. He has held product roles at Google and Groupon and has invested across deep tech, climate, space, health and consumer sectors.
enrichment.career_background: Engeström co‑founded Jaiku (acquired by Google) and Ditto (acquired by Groupon), worked as a product manager at Google and as Director of Product at Groupon, and served on the investing team at True Ventures. He co‑founded Yes VC (2018) with Caterina Fake, has been involved with Lifeline Ventures, and founded Primary Diagnostics in 2020. He sits on/has held advisory roles for multiple startups and boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed & Seed; deep tech (space, climate, carbon removal), AI, health/biotech, and consumer/mobile startups

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Pantera Capital who focuses on venture and early-stage token investments. Former software developer and trader with a B.A. in Computer Science from Columbia University. Has held board/board-observer roles at companies including Pinata, VALR, BitOasis, and Staked.
enrichment.career_background: Started as a software developer (trading platforms), moved into trading roles at Deutsche Bank and Bank of America, and joined Pantera in 2018. Progressed through investment associate and principal roles to partner/general partner, leading diligence and investments across infrastructure, DeFi, and token projects and spearheading internal staking and data initiatives.
enrichment.investment_focus: Venture and early-stage token investments in blockchain/Web3 infrastructure, DeFi, developer tools, and staking.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Director of Scalar Capital, a crypto investment firm. Former product manager at Coinbase who worked on internal compliance, fraud, and finance systems. Known for early crypto/token investments and listed on Forbes 30 Under 30 (Finance). Holds a B.A. in Economics from UC San Diego.
enrichment.career_background: Started in risk analysis at AIG, joined Coinbase in 2014 as a product manager focused on internal tools and compliance, then co‑founded Scalar Capital (2017) to invest in crypto assets and tokens; has served as an advisor to projects such as 0x and has been involved in crypto ecosystem initiatives and media (e.g., co‑producing an Ethereum documentary).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and token investments in blockchain projects: privacy tech, DeFi, layer‑2/infrastructure, NFTs, and developer/protocol tooling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and investor based in San Francisco. Founder and Managing Partner of Heretic Ventures; founder of Minted and co‑founder of Eve.com and Arcade. Sits on several boards including Victoria’s Secret & Co. and Every Mother Counts.
interests: Consumer generative AI and AI-enabled product creation
Digital art / NFTs and generative art
enrichment.career_background: Started as an analyst at Goldman Sachs, co‑founded Eve.com (sold in 2000), led product at Movielink, and launched Minted in 2007 (founder/CEO, later executive chairman). In 2021 she founded Heretic Ventures, and she is co‑founder/CEO of Arcade; she also serves on multiple corporate and nonprofit boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Building and funding consumer-facing companies at the intersection of culture, commerce, and creators — e.g., marketplaces, creator economy businesses, consumer generative AI, and blockchain/NFT-enabled digital art.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner of 1confirmation, an early-stage crypto and Web3 venture firm he launched in 2017. Previously worked in business development at Coinbase and as a principal at Runa Capital. Early investor in NFT and crypto-native projects including OpenSea and dYdX.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment roles at North Atlantic Capital, moved into business development at Coinbase (early employee), then worked at Runa Capital before founding 1confirmation in 2017. 1confirmation focuses on early-stage equity and token investments across crypto, NFTs and blockchain infrastructure.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage crypto & Web3 (NFTs, DeFi, blockchain protocols, developer tooling and token-native marketplaces).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director (early) at Redpoint Ventures focused on AI and machine learning. Former senior software engineer on LinkedIn’s machine learning team. Holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science from Yale and an M.S. (CS, AI concentration) and MBA from Stanford.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Redpoint in 2018 (initially as an intern), worked previously as a senior software engineer on LinkedIn’s machine learning team, and has led investments across AI, infrastructure, and SaaS. Promoted to Managing Director at Redpoint in May 2025.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI, Infrastructure, SaaS; stages: Seed to Series A; enterprise and developer-facing startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at FPV Ventures. Former COO of Cisco Collaboration and former COO/CIO roles at Morgan Stanley. Serves as an investor/advisor and board member across tech and biotech companies; holds a B.S. from MIT.
enrichment.career_background: Pegah Ebrahimi is co‑founder and Managing Partner of FPV Ventures (launched 2022). Prior to VC she served as COO of Cisco Collaboration, held senior COO/CIO roles at Morgan Stanley’s technology and investment banking groups, and cofounded Spark Box Toys. She sits on public and private company boards and advises companies including Canva and Snyk.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in enterprise software, developer platforms, biotech/drug discovery, and frontier technologies, with emphasis on mission-driven founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: R "Ray" Wang is Founder, Chairman, and Principal Analyst of Constellation Research and a Venture Partner at Mindful Venture Capital. He co-hosts the webcast DisrupTV and is the author of books on digital transformation, including Disrupting Digital Business (HBR Press) and Everybody Wants to Rule The World. He is a frequent keynote speaker and advisor to enterprise and startup leaders on AI, Web3, and digital strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Ray Wang founded Constellation Research (principal analyst, chairman) and previously held roles at Forrester Research, Oracle, PeopleSoft and consulting firms such as Deloitte and Ernst & Young. He co-hosts DisrupTV, has authored books on digital transformation, serves on advisory boards, and is listed as a Venture Partner at Mindful Venture Capital.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Pre-seed, Seed, Series A); enterprise software & SaaS; AI and Web3/metaverse; behavior-design informed technology; healthcare and fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at SRB Ventures and founder of SRB Holdings; author and creator who publishes The Curiosity Chronicle. Former private-equity investor (Altamont Capital Partners) with seven years of buyout experience. Stanford BA/MA; active angel/early-stage investor in 40+ startups.
enrichment.career_background: Bloom spent seven years on the investment team at Altamont Capital Partners (private equity), served on several portfolio company boards, then launched SRB Ventures (Fund I ~$10M) in January 2022 as Managing Partner. He also operates SRB Holdings (personal holding company), publishes The Curiosity Chronicle, and wrote The 5 Types of Wealth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage venture (seed–Series A); ~$100K–$250K checks; sector-agnostic technology focus including fintech, SaaS, consumer, and Web3.

enrichment.personal_bio: Tim O'Reilly is the founder, CEO and chairman of O'Reilly Media and a partner at early-stage venture firm O'Reilly AlphaTech Ventures (OATV). He helped popularize concepts such as "open source" and "Web 2.0" and convenes conferences and publications on technology trends. He serves on multiple nonprofit and company boards and is the author of WTF? What's the Future and Why It's Up to Us.
interests: Open source software and developer communities
Web platforms and internet business models
enrichment.career_background: Founded O'Reilly Media in the 1980s and grew it into a publishing, conference and learning business focused on technology; co‑founded and serves as partner at O'Reilly AlphaTech Ventures (OATV) to invest in early-stage technology companies. Active in public conversation about tech policy, open source, and the future of platforms; serves on boards including Code for America and PeerJ and has authored books on technology and society.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage / institutional-seed investments in developer tools, infrastructure, enterprise and consumer software, web platforms; support for revenue-focused Indie.VC-style financing.

enrichment.personal_bio: Tina Sharkey is an entrepreneur, investor, board member and educator best known for co-founding Brandless and co-founding iVillage. She served as CEO of Sherpa Foundry and as a venture partner at Sherpa Capital, and has held senior roles at BabyCenter (Johnson & Johnson), AOL and the Sesame Street Digital Group. Sharkey sits on several public and private boards and teaches business innovation; she is based in Northern California.
enrichment.career_background: Sharkey began her career co-founding iVillage, later led programming and community businesses at AOL, and served as Chairman & Global President of BabyCenter. In 2013 she became CEO of Sherpa Foundry and later a venture partner at Sherpa Capital before co-founding Brandless (where she served as CEO and chair). She has held board and advisory roles at companies including Ipsy, Brit + Co, Havenly and PBS, and is active as an angel and early-stage investor and lecturer.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer brands, direct-to-consumer e-commerce, marketplaces and media/community-driven startups (early stage)

enrichment.personal_bio: Travis Kalanick is an American entrepreneur, best known as the co‑founder and former CEO of Uber. In 2018 he launched the investment vehicle 10100 to oversee his for‑profit and nonprofit work focused on job creation and emerging markets. Through 10100 he took a controlling stake in City Storage Systems and is associated with CloudKitchens. Earlier in his career he co‑founded Scour and Red Swoosh.
enrichment.career_background: Kalanick co‑founded Uber and served as its CEO until 2017; he remained a significant shareholder and left the board in 2019. In March 2018 he announced the creation of 10100 to manage his investments and philanthropic work, and that fund made a controlling investment in City Storage Systems (parent of CloudKitchens), where he has taken an active leadership role. Earlier ventures include Scour and Red Swoosh; he has also made multiple angel and seed investments in startups across software, logistics and consumer tech.
enrichment.investment_focus: Real‑estate redevelopment (parking/retail/industrial), e‑commerce and marketplace businesses, emerging‑market technology in China and India; direct investments and co‑investments with emphasis on job creation and urban/future‑of‑cities initiatives.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Executive Director of Angel Labs, an investor accelerator that trains and connects angel investors and emerging GPs. Formerly worked in investment banking and at Startup Labs; educated at Université Paris‑Sorbonne and Bocconi University. Active speaker and advisor on entrepreneurship, investor education and international tech ecosystems.
enrichment.career_background: Tugce Ergul co‑founded Angel Labs in 2013 to build investor education programs and global angel networks. She began her career in investment banking (Rothschild), worked at Startup Labs managing seed‑stage activity, and has advised governments and organizations on entrepreneurship and venture finance. She holds an undergraduate degree from Université Paris‑Sorbonne and a master's from Bocconi University and is regularly featured as a speaker on international startup and VC topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel & early‑stage investing; investor education and accelerator programs; building LP/GP networks; international and emerging markets; inclusive/diverse entrepreneurship

enrichment.personal_bio: Software engineer and early-stage investor/advisor who served as a Venture Partner / campus lead for Contrary at the University of Maryland (2017–2018). Worked on infrastructure teams at Segment and Airplane and lists current work on scripting infrastructure; authored UMD course 'Practical Cloud Computing with AWS'.
enrichment.career_background: Colin King holds BS and MS degrees in Computer Science from the University of Maryland (focused on distributed systems). He founded and taught a UMD course on cloud computing, served as a Venture Partner/Advisor for Contrary at UMD (2017–2018), and has worked at Segment and Airplane (and lists work on scripting infrastructure).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / university-founded founders; cloud infrastructure and developer tools; early-stage technical founders

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing/General Partner at Devland, a venture studio and fund. Product leader, former software engineer and author who has led technology development and helped form multiple startups. Holds a B.S. in Audio Electrical Engineering from the University of Miami and served as a visiting researcher at the University of Rochester with NSF support.
enrichment.career_background: Over a decade-plus operator background as a software engineer and product manager (including product roles at major tech firms), startup founder/operator and research advocate. Co-founded and runs Devland as a studio/fund, has served as a research advisor to private equity firms and in private-investment roles (including a director-level private investments role at CG Capital).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) deep tech and industrial innovation: hardware, automation, advanced manufacturing & materials, robotics/computer vision, AR/VR and applied R&D.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Remi (direct-to-consumer sleep and dental wellness products). Former analyst and associate at Sinai Ventures (2018–2019) and BMW i Ventures (2017–2018). NYU Stern alumnus; based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an analyst at BMW i Ventures, then as an analyst and associate at Sinai Ventures where he sourced and led diligence on multiple deals. In December 2019 he founded Remi and serves as its CEO; has also served as a venture scout and remains active in VC networks and DTC entrepreneurship.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage software and internet companies; mobility & transportation; consumer DTC and health/wellness

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz, focused on consumer investing and AI-native products. Former founder (SocialDeck, Snowball) and product leader at Google and Credit Karma; joined a16z in 2019 and serves on multiple portfolio company boards.
interests: AI-native and generative AI consumer tools
enrichment.career_background: Anish graduated from the University of Waterloo and worked as a software engineer at Amazon before co-founding SocialDeck (acquired by Google). He led mobile product efforts at Google, founded Snowball (acquired by Credit Karma), held senior product and GM roles at Credit Karma, and joined Andreessen Horowitz as a General Partner in 2019; he serves on several a16z portfolio boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer technology (mobile/creator apps), fintech/consumer finance, AI/GenAI consumer products

enrichment.personal_bio: Retired professional tennis player and entrepreneur. Founder and managing partner of Serena Ventures, a venture firm that backs businesses led by women and underrepresented founders. Founder/co‑founder of consumer brands (Will Perform, WYN Beauty) and a multimedia production company (926 Productions).
interests: Investing in women and underrepresented founders
enrichment.career_background: Serena Williams rose to global prominence as a professional tennis player (turned pro 1995; 23 Grand Slam singles titles) and retired from regular tour play in 2022. Off court she founded Serena Ventures to invest in early‑stage companies focused on consumer, health, e‑commerce and tech, and has launched consumer businesses including Will Perform and WYN Beauty and a production company (926 Productions). Serena Ventures raised an inaugural outside fund (reported ~$111M) to scale the firm’s investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage consumer, healthcare/wellness, e‑commerce and tech (SaaS/TMT), media and Web3; emphasis on female and underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) focused on crypto and Web3. Previously a software engineer and researcher at Google X and Google Brain and holds BS/MS degrees in Computer Science from Stanford. Technical background in distributed systems, machine learning, and security; works closely with portfolio companies on protocol and infrastructure strategy.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Andreessen Horowitz in 2017 as the first full-time member of the crypto team and was promoted to General Partner in April 2021. Prior to VC, he worked on robotics at Google X and as a core developer on TensorFlow at Google Brain after completing BS and MS degrees in Computer Science at Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Crypto / Web3, blockchain infrastructure, privacy/zk tech, developer platforms, AI/ML (seed through growth stages)

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner and Head of the Cultural Leadership Fund (CLF) at Andreessen Horowitz, where she connects cultural leaders to technology companies and advances Black participation and wealth-generation in tech. Formerly worked in venture roles at Unusual Ventures and as an MBA investment fellow; holds an MBA from Stanford GSB.
interests: Black wealth generation & diversity in tech
Talent pipeline / HBCU and nonprofit partnerships
enrichment.career_background: Megan Holston-Alexander leads a16z’s Cultural Leadership Fund, a vehicle that coinvests across a16z portfolio companies and donates management fees/carry to nonprofits focused on advancing Black talent into tech. She previously held investor roles at Unusual Ventures, was an MBA investment fellow at Foundation Capital, interned at Lightspeed and Omidyar Network, and earlier worked in nonprofit operations and as a lecturer. She holds a BA from Clark Atlanta University, an MA from the University of Houston, and an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer and creator-economy startups, crypto, fintech, enterprise, bio/health; primarily early-stage (seed/Series A) while participating across a16z fund stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CTO of Rain, a payments/crypto-focused card platform. Previously served as an investment scout at Lightspeed Venture Partners and was a principal software engineer at Intuit after an exit of his prior startup (Playbook HR). Stanford University computer science graduate active in early‑stage investing and founder communities.
enrichment.career_background: Charles Naut co‑founded Rain (co‑founder & CTO, 2021–present). He was an Investment Scout at Lightspeed Venture Partners (circa 2020–2022), earlier co‑founded Playbook HR (acquired by Intuit) and served as a Principal Software Engineer at Intuit (2015–2019). He studied computer science at Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) startups; fintech/payments and crypto infrastructure; future‑of‑work and SMB software; developer tools / SaaS.

enrichment.firm_name: Capital Region AR/VR Accelerator (Capital Region XR Accelerator)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of EndeavorXR (formerly EndeavorVR), an XR strategy and consulting firm. Known as an XR/Metaverse futurist who advises Fortune 500s, government bodies and startups. Angel investor and listed as a Venture Partner with the Capital Region AR/VR (XR) Accelerator; serves on multiple advisory boards.
enrichment.career_background: Amy Peck is the founder and CEO of EndeavorXR, with two decades of experience in enterprise strategy, immersive technologies and commercial production. Her background includes enterprise roles at Leap Motion and HTC VIVE and corporate experience at J.P. Morgan Chase and LivingSocial. She holds advisory roles with government and corporate entities (including the Royal Commission for Riyadh City and Booz Allen-related engagements), chairs/participates in multiple industry boards, and has been publicly listed as a Venture Partner at the Capital Region AR/VR (XR) Accelerator.
enrichment.hometown: Palm Beach, FL and New York City, NY
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage/seed focus on immersive technology (XR/AR/VR), digital twins and spatial computing, metaverse/Web3 and applied AI for enterprise.

enrichment.personal_bio: Design leader and mentor based in San Francisco. Principal Product Designer at Eventbrite (formerly design leads at Google and Uber). Operates Sridesign to make small, early-stage investments into design‑led startups.
enrichment.career_background: Holds a master’s degree from Georgia Institute of Technology and a BE from Anna University. Over a decade of product design leadership with roles at Eventbrite, Google (Search), Uber (inclusive design, Uber Lite) and founding designer work at AWAKE; focuses on building products, systems and teams at the intersection of design and AI.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed investments in design‑led startups; emphasis on product design, design systems, accessibility and consumer/marketplace/hardware/transportation tech sectors.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of WhatsApp and co‑founder/executive chairman of the Signal Technology Foundation. Donated an initial $50M (structured as a loan) to launch the Signal Foundation and has led its nonprofit effort to build privacy‑focused messaging. Former software engineer and engineering leader with past roles at Apple, Adobe and Yahoo. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Brian Acton is a software engineer and entrepreneur who co‑founded WhatsApp (2009) and helped grow it through its acquisition by Facebook in 2014. He left WhatsApp in 2017 and in February 2018 co‑founded the Signal Technology Foundation with Moxie Marlinspike, providing initial funding and serving as executive chairman (and later interim CEO of Signal Messenger LLC). Earlier in his career he worked at Apple, Adobe and Yahoo in engineering roles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Privacy‑focused technology and secure messaging; open‑source software; early‑stage/seed investments in developer tools and cybersecurity.

enrichment.personal_bio: Early-stage angel investor and operator who led AngelList India and launched micro-funds including iSeed. Founder of Offline (a members' community for founders) and a partner in funds such as Galaxy and iSeed. Active investor in Indian startups across fintech, consumer, enterprise and crypto/web3.
enrichment.career_background: Somani helped bring AngelList to India and served as its India lead/partner before leaving in 2023 to start Offline. He launched the iSeed micro‑VC vehicle in 2020 (announced iSeed II in 2021) and is a partner in other early‑stage funds (including Galaxy); he has been an angel investor and board participant across multiple Indian startups since the mid‑2010s.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments across fintech, consumer (D2C/marketplaces), SaaS & enterprise, health & wellness, and web3/crypto

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor focused on pre-seed and seed opportunities. Previously a Partner at Expa and an investor at Norwest Venture Partners; earlier experience in business operations at Udemy and investment banking at Morgan Stanley. Active in consumer, marketplaces, and health-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Graduated from Stanford (B.S., Management Science & Engineering). Began in investment banking at Morgan Stanley, moved to business operations at Udemy, then venture investing at Norwest Venture Partners (2017–2020). Joined Expa’s ventures team in 2020 and was later a Partner there, sourcing and advising early-stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed; consumer marketplaces, marketplaces-enabled SaaS, digital health (including women's health), fintech, future-of-work and proptech.

name: Minn Kim
firm: Ridge Ventures (Formerly known as IDG Ventures USA)

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and founder focused on early-stage enterprise software and the future of work. Former Principal at Bloomberg Beta and Partner at On Deck; served as an Advisor/Venture Partner at Ridge Ventures. Founder and CEO of Lighthouse, a company focused on speeding skilled immigration for tech talent.
enrichment.career_background: Minn Kim invested at Bloomberg Beta (Principal) with a focus on machine intelligence and future-of-work companies, later served as a Partner at On Deck and as a Venture Partner / Advisor at Ridge Ventures. She is the founder and CEO of Lighthouse (focused on US skilled-immigration services) and has advised/seed-invested across enterprise and AI-focused startups.
enrichment.hometown: New York / New Jersey, United States
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed / Series A) enterprise software and SaaS; developer tools and infrastructure; AI/ML and future-of-work technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Matrix (matrix.vc) who focuses on early-stage fintech, vertical software and adjacent payments businesses. Former founder/operator (Bonsai, Seiza) and Head of Product at Afterpay. Based in San Francisco and writes about payments, embedded finance and vertical SaaS.
enrichment.career_background: Former founder and product leader who co-founded Bonsai and Seiza, served as Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Matrix, led product at Afterpay during its U.S. expansion, and joined Matrix as a partner investing at seed through Series A. Educated at UC Berkeley and Oxford (PPE) and participated in Y Combinator.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series A) investments in fintech, payments/embedded finance, vertical SaaS and enterprise B2B software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Simon Chan, PhD, is a General Partner at FirstHand Alliance and a serial founder-turned-investor. He co-founded PredictionIO (acquired by Salesforce) and later led product for Salesforce Einstein. He invests in early-stage B2B and AI-focused startups and is based in New York, USA.
enrichment.career_background: Simon Chan is a 4x founder and investor. He co-founded and served as CEO of PredictionIO (acquired by Salesforce), joined Salesforce to work on the Einstein platform, and later held venture roles including Venture Partner at Shasta Ventures and Executive‑in‑Residence at Sierra Ventures. He is currently a General/Managing Partner at FirstHand Alliance. Education: B.S.E. in Computer Science (University of Michigan, Ann Arbor) and Ph.D. in Machine Learning (University College London).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / Seed B2B startups (SaaS, AI/ML, developer-first tools, enterprise software)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Symbolic Capital. Ecosystem advisor to Polygon and contributor to Beacon Accelerator; former VP/GM at Huobi US and founder of Traction Labs. Early‑stage investor focused on web3 and frontier technology; has backed 100+ founders.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Traction Labs (acquired), served as Vice President and General Manager at Huobi (Huobi US), was a partner/advisor at Borderless Capital and other crypto funds, and co‑founded Symbolic Capital where he invests in early‑stage web3 and AI projects. He also serves as an ecosystem advisor to Polygon and contributes to Beacon Accelerator.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in web3/blockchain (infrastructure, DeFi), decentralized scalability, and AI/frontier technologies

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO & General Partner at StratMinds, a San Francisco–based venture capital and advisory firm focused on applied AI. Active angel/early-stage investor and advisor with a focus on AI, automation and UX/CX. Previously served in senior roles at IBM (Chief Innovation Officer) and Strategy& (Senior Partner).
enrichment.career_background: Founder and CEO of StratMinds (founded 2018), investor and advisor to early‑stage startups; prior senior roles include Chief Innovation Officer, IBM (applied AI) and Senior Partner at Strategy&. Acts as an advisor/associate with Creative Destruction Lab and has participated in fund and SPV investments across pre‑seed to Series A.
enrichment.investment_focus: Applied AI, automation, UX/CX, next‑gen commerce & computing; early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Product operator, founder and angel investor. Former product roles at Facebook, FiscalNote and Beam; co‑founder of HeadsUp (acquired by Hightouch). Served as a Sequoia Capital scout (2021–2023) and invests in early‑stage SaaS, Web3/crypto and developer-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Momo Ong is a product leader and founder who has held product roles at Facebook and product leadership roles at FiscalNote and Beam. He co‑founded HeadsUp (acquired by Hightouch in 2023), has acted as a Sequoia Capital scout (2021–2023), and is an active angel investor focused on early‑stage companies. He studied at Princeton University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre-seed/seed) startups; sectors include SaaS, Web3/crypto, sales & CRM, marketplaces and developer tools. As a Sequoia scout his typical check size was reported around $10K–$25K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner of Base Case Capital, an early-stage VC based in San Francisco. Former product manager at Samsara with earlier roles at Rough Draft Ventures, Sequoia (scout), and Greylock. Focuses on first checks into pre-product and early product teams (seed to Series A).
enrichment.career_background: Alana founded Base Case Capital in 2021 to write early checks ($100K–$5M) into builders pre-product and pre-traction. Prior to founding the firm she was a product manager at Samsara (2019–2021) and held venture roles including Rough Draft Ventures (venture fellow), Sequoia (campus scout) and an investor internship at Greylock. She studied at Columbia University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A investments in SMB/enterprise SaaS, developer tools, platform/infrastructure and product-led companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Alpine VC (alpine.vc). Previously a principal at Goodwater Capital and an associate at Redpoint Ventures; prior roles include Head of Business Operations at Stitcher and tech/finance roles earlier in his career. Holds MS and BS degrees in Computer Science from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Ed Suh founded Alpine VC in 2022 and leads the firm’s seed and Series A investing activity focused on product-led consumer and SMB software. Before founding Alpine, he spent multiple years at Goodwater Capital and Redpoint Ventures conducting seed-to-growth investments, and earlier worked in business operations at Stitcher and in technology M&A at Merrill Lynch. He holds MS and BS degrees in Computer Science from Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & Series A; consumer tech, prosumer software (creator & dev tools), SMB software; product-led growth (primarily US, with activity in Southeast Asia and other regions)

enrichment.personal_bio: Aravind “Avi” Bharadwaj is a venture investor who served as a Principal at Innovation Endeavors focused on enterprise software, data and AI/ML. He joined Intel Capital in 2022 as an Investment Director and leads investments in data/AI infrastructure and application companies.
enrichment.career_background: Avi holds an MS in Information Systems from Carnegie Mellon University. He began his career as a software engineer at Goldman Sachs, worked as a data scientist/consultant at IBM, was Principal at Innovation Endeavors (2017–2022) where he led and served as director/observer on multiple enterprise and data-focused investments, and joined Intel Capital in 2022 as an Investment Director.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software; data & analytics; AI/ML platforms; early-stage (seed–Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Nobuhiro “Nob” Seki is a serial tech entrepreneur and investor; he is Founding Partner / Chief Investment Officer at Monozukuri Ventures. He previously served as an executive and CEO at Six Apart and cofounded FabFoundry. He holds an MBA from Carnegie Mellon University and a B.S. in Engineering from the University of Tokyo.
enrichment.career_background: Nobuhiro Seki has worked at the intersection of media, engineering and product startups for decades. He served as Executive Vice President and later President & CEO at Six Apart, cofounded FabFoundry (a hardware startup platform) and helped found the Maker Bootcamp/Shisaku fund initiatives; he is a founding partner and CIO of Monozukuri Ventures, focusing on early-stage hard‑tech and manufacturing-related investments. He holds an MBA from Carnegie Mellon and a BS from the University of Tokyo.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) hardware and deep tech: manufacturing, IoT/embedded, robotics, semiconductors/edge AI, medical devices

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Maveron focused on early-stage consumer companies. Previously worked at Susa Ventures, Goldman Sachs, and Silicon Valley Bank. San Francisco native who studies consumer trends and supports D2C and consumer marketplace founders.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Maveron (team announced 2018) after roles at Susa Ventures (investor), Goldman Sachs (financial analyst) and Silicon Valley Bank (research associate). Stanford University alumnus. Serves on or advises boards including Sage and has acted as a board observer for Parade.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage consumer companies (seed/Series A); direct-to-consumer brands, consumer marketplaces, health & wellness, food/CPG, community platforms.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Emergence Capital (2003) and long‑time investor focused on enterprise SaaS and cloud business software. Founder of seed firm Moai Capital and a Lecturer at Stanford GSB on angel & venture capital financing. Experienced board member who has backed and advised dozens of software companies.
interests: Early‑stage & seed investing (including consumer & IoT via Moai)
Impact investing focused on autism employment and inclusive hiring
enrichment.career_background: Originally an engineer (Raychem, RCA, Westinghouse, Polaroid) with MS and BS in mechanical engineering from MIT and an MBA from Stanford. Early general partner at St. Paul Venture Capital, co‑founded Emergence Capital in 2003, later launched Moai Capital (seed/impact focus). Serves or has served on multiple public and private boards and teaches at Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage enterprise SaaS / cloud business software (primary); personal seed investments via Moai Capital in consumer, IoT and impact (autism employment).

enrichment.firm_name: Shift One (Sh1ft; later rebranded as Movo)
enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and operator focused on frontline workforce and logistics marketplaces. Former regional GM at Uber and COO at 99 (Brazil); founder/CEO of Shift One (now Movo). Active angel investor and growth advisor in Latin American and logistics startups.
interests: Upskilling and training for hourly workers
enrichment.career_background: Jason Radisson began at McKinsey, scaled operations at Uber as a regional GM, and served as COO of 99 in Brazil. He founded Shift One (Sh1ft), which later became Movo, and has been an angel investor and advisor to startups in logistics, recommerce and labor marketplaces.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/angel) investments in frontline workforce, logistics and HR/marketplace startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Ventures focusing on infrastructure software, cybersecurity and AI incubations. Former product leader at Atlassian; studied at UCLA. Founded and runs BCV Labs to incubate AI companies and technical founders. Promoted to partner at BCV in January 2024.
enrichment.career_background: Studied computer science at UCLA and worked as a product manager (including at Redfin and Atlassian) before joining Bain Capital Ventures in 2021. At BCV he has led and advised early-stage investments in AI infrastructure and security, launched BCV Labs (an AI incubator), and was promoted to partner in January 2024.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/Series A) investments in infrastructure software, AI infrastructure & developer tools, and cybersecurity; incubation of AI startups via BCV Labs.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Cabin and former product leader at Instacart. Executive-in-residence at Reforge (2021–2022) and an investor/advisor affiliated with Seed Club Ventures, focused on community-led and web3 projects.
enrichment.career_background: Jonathan Hillis led product for Instacart (shoppers & marketplace), served as Executive-in-Residence at Reforge, and founded Cabin (a network-city / creator-community project). He also advises and invests in early-stage web3 and community-focused startups through Seed Club Ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) Web3, DAO tooling, community-owned platforms

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at The Robotics Hub focused on creating and de-risking early-stage companies in robotics and augmented intelligence. Holds a Ph.D. in AI from the University of New South Wales; former CTO at Kyndi and Chief Technologist at Citrix. Serves as a mentor/associate at Creative Destruction Lab and advises multiple deep‑tech startups.
enrichment.career_background: Technologist and investor with a Ph.D. in AI (UNSW) and a B.Ec (University of Sydney). Worked in R&D and product roles, founded/led startups (ImpSys), served as Chief Technologist at Citrix Startup Accelerator, was CTO at Kyndi, and since 2017 has been a Partner at The Robotics Hub advising and investing in early‑stage robotics and AI companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Robotics and augmented intelligence (AI/ML); early‑stage and seed investments; deep‑tech commercialization; enterprise/cloud infrastructure and healthcare/precision medicine

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lattice Ventures and experienced early-stage investor. Former General Manager of the USV Network at Union Square Ventures and founder of startups including gtrot (acquired by Groupon) and VetsinTech NYC. BA in Marketing and International Business from NYU Stern; active in blockchain/Web3, fintech, and community-driven startups.
enrichment.career_background: Brittany Laughlin began her career in product and small-business roles at American Express, founded travel startup gtrot (acquired by Groupon) and VetsinTech NYC, then joined Union Square Ventures as General Manager of the USV network. She co-founded Lattice Ventures (partner) to invest in seed and early-stage companies and has held roles in the Blockstack/Stacks ecosystem and related foundations. She holds a BA from NYU Stern and has written and spoken on investing, community, and token-based ecosystems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage venture; blockchain/Web3, fintech, marketplaces, developer & platform tools, community/network-effect businesses

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Hello Patient and former Sr. Director of Product at Carbon Health. Entrepreneur and angel investor who has backed 80+ startups and is reported as a part‑time/venture partner at Bloom Venture Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Alex Cohen co‑founded Birch (acquired by Even Financial), later co‑founded CommandDot, and led consumer & growth product at Carbon Health (Sr. Director of Product). In 2024 he co‑founded Hello Patient (CEO). He is an active angel investor (personal site lists 80+ investments) and is reported in media and industry directories as a venture partner/part‑time investor at Bloom Venture Partners.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare, B2B SaaS, Prosumer SaaS, Fintech, AI (seed / early-stage)

enrichment.personal_bio: Alex (Alexander) Danco is a writer and product/systems professional currently at Shopify who previously worked as an Associate at Social Capital. He publishes a long-form newsletter and writes about technology, markets, crypto, startups and cities. He is based in Toronto.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as an Associate at Social Capital (joined in late 2015; left in 2019) before joining Shopify as a product/systems and crypto-focused staffer. He publishes a widely read newsletter (alexdanco.com / danco.substack.com) and has written extensively on markets, venture, and technology. He studied neuroscience at McGill University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage technology with emphasis on crypto/decentralized systems, commerce/e‑commerce infrastructure, and product/systems-level companies

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor at Bloomberg Beta (joined 2022). Former founder of Seer Tracking (satellite collision prediction) and partner at Dorm Room Fund. Holds BS and MS in Computer Science from Stanford and writes about technology and philosophy publicly.
enrichment.career_background: Amber Yang founded Seer Tracking (satellite-situational-awareness software), served as an investment partner at Dorm Room Fund, worked in ML research and product roles (including MIT Lincoln Laboratory/Astranis and product work during her studies), and joined Bloomberg Beta’s investing team in 2022 after completing MS and BS degrees in Computer Science at Stanford.
enrichment.investment_focus: Machine intelligence (AI), the future of work, developer tools, data & infrastructure, and robotics

enrichment.personal_bio: Eric Ross Weinstein is a mathematician and economist (PhD, Harvard) known for public-facing work (host of The Portal) and for proposing the Geometric Unity idea. He served as a managing director at Thiel Capital and has held research fellow roles at the Mathematical Institute, Oxford. His public work focuses on math/physics, economics, and technology policy.
enrichment.career_background: Harvard PhD in mathematical physics (1992). Founder/principal of the Natron Group (hedge/quant work), visiting research fellow at Oxford's Mathematical Institute, and subsequently served as a managing director at Thiel Capital (joined circa 2013; reported association through 2022). Host of the Portal podcast and participant in public science projects (e.g., Galileo Project).
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology and life‑sciences; early‑ to later‑stage venture investments (focus associated with Thiel Capital)

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Innogen Capital. Co‑founder/leader of Seed Community and SNBX; serves on boards including Seed Communities and Patronato Grupo FUSAL. Bachelor’s degree in Business/Managerial Economics – Entrepreneurship from Bentley University.
enrichment.career_background: Fernando Morán is a managing partner at Innogen Capital and a co‑founder of Seed Community and SNBX. He has experience in community management, entrepreneurship education (including teaching roles), business development, and angel investing, and serves on several non‑profit and startup boards. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Bentley University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage technology startups across Latin America (Central America, Mexico, Andean and Southern Cone). Sector focus includes fintech, healthtech, AI/data, proptech, logistics and marketplaces, with emphasis on proven business models and social impact.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investment Partner / General Partner at Chapter One Ventures focused on early-stage companies. Former tech lead for platform manipulation at Twitter with a background in data science and professional sports betting. Based in London and active in writing about AI and venture topics.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Chapter One's investing team and serves as an Investment/General Partner. Previously the technical lead for Twitter's platform-manipulation team (fake account detection, coordinated online harm, investigations) and earlier worked as a professional sports bettor on a team led by Haralabos Voulgaris. Holds undergraduate degrees from Boston College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed / seed-stage investments in AI/ML, data & infrastructure, developer tools, SaaS, fintech, blockchain; emphasis on platform integrity and product-driven founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Product leader and angel investor who has held senior product roles at Airbnb, Amazon and Alchemy. Served as a Sequoia Capital scout (2018–2023) and invests in early-stage web3, marketplaces and SaaS startups.
enrichment.career_background: Jason Shah is a former founder (Do.com) and product executive with roles at Microsoft, Yammer, Amazon, and Airbnb; he later joined Alchemy in senior product/growth roles. He served as a Sequoia Capital scout starting in 2018 and has been an active early-stage investor and advisor; he holds an AB from Harvard University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed–Series B); Web3/crypto and blockchain infrastructure; marketplaces; SaaS; developer tools and APIs

enrichment.personal_bio: Associate / investor at XYZ Venture Capital (joined 2020). Focuses on seed and Series A investing in FinTech, payments and enterprise software. Founder of the "Breaking into Venture" program at BLCK VC and a UC Berkeley alumnus.
enrichment.career_background: Joined XYZ Venture Capital in 2020 and has been promoted to Associate; prior roles include Investment Partner at Dorm Room Fund, Summer Associate at Base Ventures, Program Lead / founder of Breaking into Venture at BLCK VC, Business Analyst (Latin America corporate & investment banking) at Citi, and Analyst at BBVA Compass. Educated at University of California, Berkeley (Political Economy) with coursework/certificates from the Sutardja Center; bilingual IB diploma from UWC‑USA.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed�6 Series A) investments in FinTech, payments infrastructure and enterprise software

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner and General Partner of Pioneer Bio+Health Fund, investing in early-stage biotechnology, medtech, life sciences and healthcare. Previously co‑founded Voyage Biomedical (YC S19), a medtech startup acquired by Penumbra. Trained as a mechanical engineer and bioengineer (Clemson; UC Berkeley/UCSF).
enrichment.career_background: Leads the Pioneer Bio+Health Fund at Pioneer Fund, focusing on seed/early-stage bio & health investments. Prior roles include co‑founder and CTO of Voyage Biomedical (YC S19, acquired by Penumbra), engineering lead at Cradle Healthcare Company, and entrepreneur-in-residence/mentor in university startup programs. Educational background in mechanical engineering and bioengineering (Clemson; UC Berkeley/UCSF).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage biotechnology, life sciences, medtech and healthcare (seed/YC-focused investments)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & CEO of Gen Z VCs, a global community for Gen Z investors, founders, and operators. Previously worked in growth equity and early-stage VC (General Atlantic and Lerer Hippeau) and was named to Forbes 30 Under 30. Focuses on Gen Z consumer and technology trends, community building, and mentorship.
enrichment.career_background: Meagan Loyst founded Gen Z VCs in 2020 and now runs the community full-time. She began her investing career at General Atlantic (growth equity) and later joined Lerer Hippeau as the youngest associate; she left to scale Gen Z VCs and pursue advisory, speaking, and consulting work. Education includes a bachelor’s from Boston College and study at Saïd Business School, University of Oxford (MBA program).
enrichment.hometown: Long Island, New York, United States
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed) technology and consumer startups, especially companies and founders building for Gen Z and creator-led / community-driven businesses.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Stage 2 Capital focused on infrastructure software and developer-facing platforms. Previously a vice president at Bessemer Venture Partners where he worked on developer platforms, data infrastructure and ML tooling. Holds dual bachelor’s degrees and a master’s in Materials Science & Engineering and a B.S. in Economics from the University of Pennsylvania.
enrichment.career_background: Started in engineering and technical roles before moving into tech investment banking at Morgan Stanley and product management at Viagogo. Joined Bessemer Venture Partners in 2015 and was promoted to vice president (profiled by Bessemer in 2021); in September 2023 he joined Stage 2 Capital as a partner. Educated at the University of Pennsylvania (summa cum laude; MS and BS in Materials Science & Engineering; BS in Economics/Wharton).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B software with emphasis on infrastructure software, developer platforms, data/ML infrastructure and developer tools (Seed–Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Ubiquity Ventures, a seed-stage firm investing in “software beyond the screen” (smart hardware and machine-learning-enabled physical systems). Former investor at Bessemer Venture Partners and founder/CEO of Triangulate. Holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BS in Computer Science from UNC Chapel Hill.
enrichment.career_background: Sunil Nagaraj founded Ubiquity Ventures in 2017 and leads the firm's seed-stage investments in companies that apply software and ML outside traditional screens. Earlier he spent several years at Bessemer Venture Partners (leading early investments including Auth0 and Zapier), founded Triangulate (VC-backed startup), and has held roles at Bain & Company, Cisco, and Microsoft. He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BS in Computer Science from UNC Chapel Hill.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed-stage investments in "software beyond the screen" — smart hardware, machine learning, developer platforms; B2B enterprise and physical-world software.

enrichment.personal_bio: Tomas Barreto is an engineering leader and angel investor who served as a scout for Sequoia Capital. He co‑founded Okay (CTO), which was acquired by Stripe, and previously served as VP of engineering at Box and Checkr. He advises and has invested in early‑stage developer tools, fintech, and health startups.
enrichment.career_background: Tomas spent over a decade at Box in multiple engineering leadership roles, later served as VP of Product & Engineering at Checkr, co‑founded Okay (acquired by Stripe in 2023) and served as a scout for Sequoia Capital. He has advised 20+ startups (including Loom, Modern Treasury and Oura) and works with early‑stage founding teams on engineering, hiring and operational scaling.
enrichment.investment_focus: Developer tools & engineering productivity; Enterprise SaaS; FinTech infrastructure

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Page One Ventures based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Founder and former CEO of Skymind and Pathmind, and previously a journalist at The New York Times and Bloomberg. Focuses on early-stage deals in B2B SaaS, data/AI, deep tech and life sciences.
enrichment.career_background: Former journalist (The New York Times, Bloomberg), later head of communications/recruiting at FutureAdvisor. Co‑founded Skymind (YC W16) and later founded Pathmind; held operational roles including at Clipboard Health. Joined Page One Ventures as a Venture Partner in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed/pre-seed) investments in deep tech, life sciences and B2B software—particularly data/infra and AI.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Launch House and a general partner / managing partner at Launch House Ventures (House Capital). Founder & CEO of Micro (an email/CRM/productivity startup); previously a product manager at Google and Clearbit. Writes and runs the tech newsletter Homescreen and is an active angel investor at pre‑seed/seed stages.
enrichment.career_background: Brett co‑founded Launch House (a membership community and venture arm House Capital) and serves as a GP / managing partner for its venture activity. He founded and leads Micro (an email/CRM/productivity startup), previously held product roles at Google and Clearbit, and helped create Accenture Ventures. He publishes the Homescreen newsletter and is active as an angel investor focused on pre‑seed and seed deals.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed and seed stage; sectors include Web3/Crypto, B2B SaaS & enterprise, AR/VR, social & messaging, and creator/founder communities.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing director of gener8tor, a nationally scaled startup accelerator. He runs gener8tor’s accelerator and skills programs, focusing on early‑stage companies and community-driven startup ecosystems. Trained as an attorney (J.D., University of Wisconsin) and previously served as a federal law clerk and an associate at Quarles & Brady.
enrichment.career_background: Joe Kirgues co‑founded gener8tor (2011/2012) and serves as its managing director. Before gener8tor he clerked for the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Wisconsin and worked as an associate at Quarles & Brady. At gener8tor he has scaled nationwide accelerator, gBETA and Skills programs and serves on regional economic and entrepreneurship boards (e.g., WEDC roles reported).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early stage via accelerator programs; sector‑agnostic with activity in SaaS, marketplaces, fintech, healthtech/medtech, edtech, food & beverage, cleantech and workforce/skills initiatives.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Metagrove Ventures, an early-stage fund linking Silicon Valley and ANZ/SEA. Former operator and engineering/product leader with experience across startups and corporates; hosts The Prompt podcast and founded Argon Labs. Holds dual degrees (BEng Hons; BBus) from University of Technology Sydney.
interests: Early‑stage (pre‑seed / seed) startups scaling between US and ANZ
enrichment.career_background: Barry has worked in engineering, product and growth roles at organisations including CSIRO, BAE Systems, Cochlear, Sensity Systems (acquired by Verizon), Skylo (SoftBank‑backed) and Verizon. He founded Metagrove Ventures (2022) to invest across Australia, New Zealand and the US, and later founded Argon Labs (technical content agency). He also hosts The Prompt podcast and mentors startups (including Techstars).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to seed investments in industrial and enterprise technology across Australia/New Zealand, Southeast Asia and the US — sectors include industrial/logistics/supply‑chain, construction, digital health and foundational software; technology enablers include AI/ML, robotics, automation, and IoT.

enrichment.personal_bio: Technologist and entrepreneur with 25+ years in startups and infrastructure software. Founding Partner at Next Wave Partners and portfolio manager of a private/family investment vehicle; frequently serves as interim CTO or VP Product for portfolio companies. Writes and publishes analysis on AI, edge computing, and venture strategy.
enrichment.career_background: James Thomason is a founding partner of Next Wave Partners and a portfolio manager/analyst who combines hands‑on product engineering experience with securities research. He co‑founded EDJX and has served in senior technical leadership roles (including CTO at HyperGrid and senior roles at Dell), holds patents in cloud/edge and distributed systems, and contributes technology and industry analysis to outlets such as VentureBeat.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software, digital infrastructure, edge computing, AI, industrial robotics, IoT, and sustainable / infrastructure tech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on early-stage hard-tech and climate companies. Former Principal at Bleu Capital where he led investments across manufacturing, energy and systems-of-production sectors; earlier growth roles at Ara Labs. Educated at Wharton; based in Miami.
enrichment.career_background: Wharton-educated investor and operator. Early career growth and operations roles at Ara Labs (formerly Cargo). Served as Investment Associate then Principal at Bleu Capital, leading early-stage investments in climate and production-focused companies; later joined ImmuneCo (MoldCo) as Head of Growth while continuing angel/deal activity.
enrichment.hometown: Grew up in France; born in Singapore
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A); sectors include systems of production, climate/energy, manufacturing & materials, and supply-chain; typical check $150K–$500K.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and General Partner at Fractal Capital based in San Francisco. Early‑stage, founder‑first investor focused on longevity and deep tech. Serial founder — co‑founded VocalEyes and Transcend (both had small exits/acqui‑hires) — and also a musician.
enrichment.career_background: Serial founder turned investor. Co‑founded VocalEyes (computer‑vision product for the visually impaired; IP/exits reported) and Transcend (acqui‑hire reported), served in operator roles at small startups/agencies, and launched Fractal Capital to make early checks and back founders. Active as an angel/scout in pre‑seed and seed stages and publishes occasional posts about investing and founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Longevity and deep tech; early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) founder‑first investments, with interest in AI/ML and biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former Principal at Floodgate and co-founder/GP of Formation VC. Previously worked in corporate strategy at Noble Energy and co-founded Digital Stairway and the GSB 20|20 Fund. MBA from Stanford GSB; BBA/BA from the University of Texas at Austin.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in strategic planning and finance at Noble Energy (corporate strategy), co-founded Digital Stairway (digital marketing), co-founded the GSB 20|20 Fund while at Stanford, served as a Principal at Floodgate (early-stage VC), and co-founded Formation VC (co‑founder/GP).
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups; marketing/advertising technologies; consumer and education technology; space/technical startups

enrichment.personal_bio: Former investment associate/principal at iSelect Fund focused on agtech, food and health startups. Graduated Cal Poly (BS Environmental Management, 2015) and was a Venture for America fellow. Left iSelect in May 2023 and joined EarthOptics as Director of Strategy. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: David Yocom earned a BS in Environmental Management from California Polytechnic State University (2015), completed a Venture for America fellowship and joined iSelect Fund’s investment team as an analyst/associate (later principal). At iSelect he evaluated and led early-stage investments in agriculture, food and health startups. He left iSelect in May 2023 and took on a Director of Strategy role at EarthOptics, working on business development, product strategy and fundraising.
enrichment.investment_focus: AgTech, food & nutrition, and healthtech; early-stage venture investments (seed–Series A)

enrichment.personal_bio: Limited Partner / Venture Partner affiliated with Interlock Capital and active as an angel investor and advisor. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, he focuses on early-stage deals and supports underrepresented founders through mentoring and community funds.
enrichment.career_background: Operator and consultant background with roles in digital transformation and advisory; active as an angel investor, limited partner in multiple community/rolling funds, and mentor (including Techstars and On Deck). Participates as a venture fellow/scout and advises startups across product, go-to-market, and capital-raising topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups across Web3/Blockchain, Creator Economy, FinTech, SaaS, and Real Estate/PropTech

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner of HF Scale (the late-stage/growth arm affiliated with Hustle Fund). Former high-yield research analyst and investor at Bank of America and Brigade Capital. Founder and former CEO of CPG brand Watermelon Road (asset sold in 2020).
enrichment.career_background: Jamie began her career in high-yield research and investment banking (Bank of America Merrill Lynch), later worked as a research analyst at Brigade Capital, then founded CPG company Watermelon Road (2017–2020, later sold). Since 2021 she has managed HF Scale (Hustle Fund’s Series B–pre-IPO platform), focusing on growth investments and secondary opportunities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Series B through pre-IPO / growth-stage technology and consumer companies; minority growth equity and secondary transactions; consumer (CPG) and digital health sectors.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor who worked on the pre-seed/seed practice at Forum Ventures (formerly Acceleprise), focused on early-stage B2B SaaS. Contributor and writer for outlets including TechCrunch. Background includes early-stage investing at VU Venture Partners, sales & trading at RBC, and co-founding a public-health startup during college.
enrichment.career_background: Pranavi Cheemakurti has worked on pre-seed and seed investments at Forum Ventures (formerly Acceleprise), sourcing and supporting early B2B SaaS deals. Prior roles include early-stage investing at VU Venture Partners and a sales & trading summer analyst role at RBC; she also co-founded a public-health startup and has written about venture topics for TechCrunch and other outlets.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed B2B SaaS / enterprise software; verticals include healthtech (femtech), fintech, supply chain & e-commerce, and applied AI.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑Founder and Managing Partner at COSIMO Ventures (also branded COSIMO digital). Serial entrepreneur and product leader who founded early internet fintech GALT/NETworth (acquired by Intuit), led startups acquired by Lycos and Nielsen, and has launched 50+ products. MBA from Carnegie Mellon; former U.S. Naval Flight Officer.
enrichment.career_background: Rob Frasca is co‑founder and managing partner of COSIMO Ventures (COSIMO digital), a Boston‑based firm that runs tokenized venture funds (COSIMO X/Y) and invests in blockchain, crypto and deep‑tech startups. He previously founded multiple startups (including GALT/NETworth and Affinnova) that achieved exits to Intuit, Lycos and Nielsen, has served in executive roles at several technology companies, and holds a BS from Rochester Institute of Technology and an MBA/MSIA from Carnegie Mellon.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (Seed/Series A) investments in blockchain, cryptocurrencies, Web3, tokenization, DeFi, digital asset infrastructure and adjacent deep‑tech (fintech, AI).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner at Pebblebed and technologist with senior engineering roles at Microsoft, Facebook (AI research), OpenAI (early team), and Stripe (AI lead). Focuses on early-stage investments in AI, computing infrastructure and developer tools. Holds a BA in Computer Science and Mathematics from the University of Washington.
enrichment.career_background: Pamela Vagata is a software engineer-turned-investor who co‑founded Pebblebed to back technical founders building ambitious AI and infrastructure products. Earlier she worked at Microsoft, helped build Facebook’s AI infrastructure (including FBLearner Flow), was an early member of OpenAI, and served as Stripe’s AI tech lead before moving into venture.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed–Series A) investments in AI and machine learning, computing infrastructure & developer tools, MLOps/production ML, and TechBio.

enrichment.personal_bio: Marketing executive and AAPI community advocate. Global Head of Social Marketing at Meta and Executive Director/Head of Meta Prosper. Angel investor with Hyphen Capital and advisor to early-stage consumer brands.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced marketing leader who has held senior brand and social roles at Meta (Global Head of Social Marketing; Head/Executive Director of Meta Prosper), Airbnb, Gap (Hill City), Snapchat and Nike. Active on several nonprofit/advisory boards including the Smithsonian Asian Pacific American Center, The Asian American Foundation (TAAF), Reimagine and LAAUNCH.
enrichment.investment_focus: Multi-stage investments in startups led by AAPI founders; consumer/DTC, social/advertising, and early-stage tech (seed to growth).

enrichment.personal_bio: Marianna Bonechi is a co‑founder and General Partner at Slava Ventures. Born in Ukraine, she splits her time between Menlo Park and Vienna and has 14+ years of experience in corporate development and M&A across TMT in New York, Vienna and CEE. In Silicon Valley she became a founder and early‑stage investor focused on Ukrainian AI and deep‑tech startups.
