Co‑founder and chairman at M34 Capital. Longstanding angel investor through a family fund (Hornthal Investment Partners) and a lecturer/fellow in entrepreneurship at UC Berkeley and other universities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology products and services; early‑stage / seed investments; commercializing technologies spun out of research.

enrichment.personal_bio: Jonah Goodhart is a New York–based entrepreneur and angel investor. He co-founded WGI Group and co-founded and served as CEO of Moat (acquired by Oracle). He currently co-runs Montauk Labs and invests in early-stage technology companies, particularly in adtech and media.
enrichment.career_background: Jonah began building internet businesses at Cornell (Colonize.com), was a founding investor in Right Media, co-founded Smarter Ad Group, and co-founded Moat (served as CEO; acquired by Oracle). He is a founding partner of WGI Group (seed/early-stage fund) and co-founder of Montauk Labs; he sits on several boards and advises adtech/media startups. He studied at Cornell University (B.A.).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology investments (adtech, enterprise SaaS, consumer internet, media/publisher tech)

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on Redpoint’s early-stage team; joined Redpoint in 2021 and focuses on enterprise software including developer tools, AI, security, and cloud infrastructure. Holds a BS and MS from Stanford University and previously worked at early-stage roles across startups and at C3.ai, Palantir and RelateIQ. Active as a board observer / seed investor across multiple infrastructure and AI startups.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Redpoint in 2021 (Principal, later promoted to Partner in 2023) to invest in Seed/Series A enterprise companies. Prior roles include forward‑deployed solutions and engineering/product positions at C3.ai, Palantir and RelateIQ, and operating/investor roles at small startups; holds BS and MS from Stanford (Computer Science and Management Science & Engineering).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A enterprise software (developer tools, infrastructure, AI, security, and SaaS)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of On Deck and an active angel investor based in San Francisco. Serves as an investor/partner supporting founders through Kepler Operator’s Fund and related Kepler Ventures efforts. Focuses on early‑stage, operator‑led deals and founder network building.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and leader at On Deck (founder fellowship and founder support programs). Earlier roles include growth at Virta Health and co‑founder of Within Health. Runs founder support and angel investing activities through Kepler Ventures / Kepler Operator’s Fund and a personal syndicate, backing many early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & pre‑seed; AI and enterprise software; digital health; web3/DAOs; operator‑led, founder‑support investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner (Partner Emeritus) at Wildcat Venture Partners. Early-stage investor focused on AI/ML-enabled platforms for retail, marketplaces and workforce automation. Formerly at Mohr Davidow Ventures and Vantage Partners.
enrichment.career_background: Katherine Barr is a founding partner of Wildcat Venture Partners. She previously served as a general partner at Mohr Davidow Ventures and began her career as a senior negotiator at Vantage Partners; earlier roles include product and marketing management at HSA and ACCESS. She has served on multiple boards and advisory councils and holds degrees from McGill University and Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage B2B and B2B2C technology (digital health, enterprise SaaS, retail/e‑commerce, marketplaces); AI/ML and workforce automation (robotics).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Selva Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on consumer health & wellness brands. Previously a partner on CircleUp Growth Partners and a private equity investor at TPG; began his career in investment banking at Barclays. Serves on/observes multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Kiva Dickinson founded Selva Ventures in 2019 and leads deal sourcing and execution for the firm. Prior to Selva he was a Partner at CircleUp Growth Partners (led Series B investments including Nutpods and Liquid I.V.), before which he worked in private equity at TPG in San Francisco and began his career in consumer-focused investment banking at Barclays in Los Angeles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & Series A consumer brands (health, wellness, beauty, branded CPG); primarily US & Canada.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Contrary (joined 2022), where he leads seed-to-growth investing and helped build the firm’s later-stage practice. Previously a growth investor at TCV and held investing roles at Coatue and Index Ventures. Publishes the Investing 101 newsletter and frequently speaks on AI and venture topics.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in growth and venture roles at TCV, Coatue, and Index/Index Ventures before joining Contrary as a General Partner in 2022 to lead later-stage and Series A investing. Educational background includes Brigham Young University and the University of Cambridge.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- to growth-stage technology investments (AI, cybersecurity, enterprise software, fintech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Paradox Capital and chief marketing officer at Wander. Former Head of Brand Marketing at Opendoor and Head of Marketing at Fast. Hosts the Paradox Podcast and invests at seed/pre-seed in consumer and developer-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Kyle Tibbitts is a marketer‑turned‑investor who co-founded Paradox Capital to back founders outside Silicon Valley. He was the second marketing hire and Head of Brand Marketing at Opendoor, later led marketing at Fast, and joined Wander as CMO. He runs the Paradox Podcast and leverages his operator background to advise portfolio founders on product, marketing and go‑to‑market.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage checks into consumer marketplaces, travel/hospitality, proptech, marketplaces/SaaS, and founder-led growth/marketing teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: Laura Deming is a New Zealand–born venture capitalist who founded The Longevity Fund to back early-stage companies working on aging and life-extension. She began laboratory work in biogerontology as a child, attended MIT as a teenager, and was a Thiel Fellow before launching the fund. She has led an accelerator and later initiatives (age1) focused on founder-led longevity companies.
enrichment.career_background: Deming moved from New Zealand to the U.S. to pursue aging research, worked in academic labs (including Cynthia Kenyon's), enrolled at MIT at a young age, accepted a Thiel Fellowship, and founded The Longevity Fund in 2011 to invest in longevity-focused startups. She has run an accelerator (AGE1), helped launch successor fund efforts (age1), and holds founder/board/advisor roles in several portfolio companies and ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early-stage biotechnology and therapeutics targeting aging and age-related disease (geroscience, senolytics, gene editing, translational longevity platforms).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Mischief, an early‑stage VC based in San Francisco. Previously founded Dote (Gen‑Z shopping app) and has been an active angel investor in companies such as Faire and Modern Fertility. Early career roles include Product Manager at Pocket Gems and Associate Consultant at Bain & Company. Graduated from Dartmouth College and grew up in Alaska.
enrichment.career_background: Lauren co‑founded Mischief (launched 2021) and invests at seed/Series A primarily in software startups. She was founder & CEO of Dote (2014–2020), earlier worked as a product manager at Pocket Gems and as an associate consultant at Bain & Company, and has angel investments dating back to 2017. She is based in San Francisco and holds a BA from Dartmouth College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage software (seed & Series A); consumer products and marketplaces; fintech & payments; SaaS; crypto/web3; healthcare

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at First Round Capital (San Francisco) since 2023. Former co-founder & CEO of WayUp (launched 2014; raised >$40M; exited/merged in 2021) and Visiting Group Partner at Y Combinator. Angel investor since 2016 with early-stage bets in Ramp, Scale AI and Ro.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in product marketing at Google before co-founding WayUp, where she served as CEO for seven years, raised venture capital and led the company through an exit in 2021. Began angel investing in 2016, later served as a Visiting Group Partner at Y Combinator (supporting 100+ startups) and joined First Round Capital as a Partner in 2023 focused on hands-on support for early-stage founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and pre-seed investments across enterprise/B2B SaaS, AI, fintech and healthtech; founder-first, GTM-heavy, hands-on early-stage partnering

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director on Redpoint’s growth / early‑growth team. Joined Redpoint in 2020 after several years at Battery Ventures and focuses primarily on enterprise software at the application and infrastructure layers, partnering with companies mostly at the Series B–C stage. Hosts a technology podcast and has been named to Forbes 30 Under 30 and the Midas Brink lists.
enrichment.career_background: Previously an investor at Battery Ventures (focused on enterprise software growth investments). Earlier experience in investment banking at Spurrier Capital Partners and Deutsche Bank. Holds a BS from Washington and Lee University, where he played varsity men’s lacrosse.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software (applications and infrastructure); growth‑stage investments (Series B and Series C).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Founder Gym and former Kapor Capital portfolio services director; active angel investor and member of First Round’s Angel Track and a Sequoia scout. Works on training and funding underrepresented founders and early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur and operator turned investor and operator. Co‑founded Tioki and later founded Founder Gym (an accelerator for underrepresented founders). Served as Global Director for Startup Weekend Education and Founding Portfolio Services Director at Kapor Capital. Member of First Round’s Angel Track and a Sequoia scout/angel investor; served as CEO of All Raise (2022–2023) and holds board/advisory roles in nonprofit and startup communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel and scout investments in seed / early-stage startups, with emphasis on education, impact and consumer internet; supporting underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Marketing and communications executive and investor. Cofounder of The OutCast Agency (1997) and operating partner / head of marketing at Andreessen Horowitz (joined 2010; partner emeritus). Member of the Broadway Angels angel group and active as an adviser to early-stage technology founders.
enrichment.career_background: Margit co‑founded The OutCast Agency in 1997 and led its growth before joining Andreessen Horowitz in 2010 to build the firm’s marketing and communications function. She advises portfolio founders on PR, brand and go‑to‑market strategy; serves on several boards and trustee bodies; and is a member of the Broadway Angels angel investing group.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage / angel investments in information technology and software; advising founders on marketing, communications and brand strategy.

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor and advisor focused on B2B SaaS and developer-led products. Former SVP, Marketing & Growth at Auth0 and interim CMO/advisor roles at Vercel and others. Serves as a GP/co-founder at HyperGrowth Partners and as a scout for Madrona; based in the Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Martin began as a software engineer and developer advocate, rose through growth/marketing leadership at Auth0 (SVP, Marketing & Growth), co‑founded HyperGrowth Partners (GP/GTM advisor) and has held interim CMO/advisor roles (e.g., Vercel, Deepgram). He is listed as a Madrona scout (2023) and makes angel/seed investments, focusing on marketing‑tech, developer platforms and SaaS.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology: B2B SaaS, developer tools, cloud & infra, applied AI, marketplaces

enrichment.personal_bio: Meena Harris is co-founder and General Partner at Phenomenal Ventures and the founder & CEO of Phenomenal Media. She is a Stanford and Harvard Law graduate, a #1 New York Times bestselling children’s author, and a Tony Award-winning producer. Harris previously worked at Facebook, Slack, Uber and practiced law at Covington & Burling.
interests: Early-stage enterprise, fintech and commerce startups
enrichment.career_background: Meena Harris began her career in community operations and tech roles at Facebook and Slack, practiced data/privacy law at Covington & Burling, and led strategy and leadership at Uber. In 2017 she founded Phenomenal (a media/consumer brand) and expanded into publishing, production and investment; in 2022 she co‑founded Phenomenal Ventures to back early-stage startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A (typical check size $100K–$500K); enterprise software, fintech, commerce, media/content and consumer startups; helping companies reach underserved or underrepresented audiences.

enrichment.personal_bio: Canadian-born entrepreneur and investor based in Vancouver. Venture partner / strategic advisor at Voyager Capital with a background building marketplaces and brand businesses; co-founder of youth accelerator The Next Big Thing. Focuses on sourcing and supporting Pacific Northwest and Western Canada B2B software founders.
enrichment.career_background: Meredith Powell is a serial entrepreneur-turned-investor who co-founded Powell & Company and the youth accelerator The Next Big Thing. She joined Voyager Capital as the firm’s Canadian venture partner (announced 2018) and has served as a strategic advisor and board member for regional ecosystem organizations; she also held a role with Microsoft for Startups (Global CMO role reported 2019–2020) and advises/angel-invests in early-stage tech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: B2B software (SaaS, cloud infrastructure), AI/ML; stages: seed to growth; geography: Pacific Northwest & Western Canada (WA, OR, BC, AB)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Framework Ventures, a crypto‑native venture firm focused on DeFi and Web3. Previously co‑founded Hashletes and worked as a product manager at Dropbox and Snap. Attended Yale University.
enrichment.career_background: Michael Anderson co‑founded Framework Ventures in 2019 with Vance Spencer. Before Framework he co‑founded Hashletes (an NFL‑licensed digital collectibles startup) and was a product manager at Dropbox and Snap; he studied at Yale University and moved into crypto investing and protocol support thereafter.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in DeFi and Web3 protocols, blockchain infrastructure, web3 gaming, and token‑based networks (tokenomics, governance).

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Founder and Managing Partner of Heroic Ventures, founder and executive chairman of Reputation.com, and CEO/founder of Modelcode.ai. Known for work on online reputation management, digital privacy, and applied AI; author and occasional Harvard Law lecturer.
interests: Applied AI in Israel and Silicon Valley
enrichment.career_background: Michael Fertik is a founder‑operator turned VC: he co‑founded Reputation.com (now executive chairman), launched Heroic Ventures (managing partner) to lead formation and first‑money investments, and founded/operates Modelcode.ai. He holds a J.D. from Harvard Law School, is named on multiple patents, and has written and appeared widely on privacy, tech, and business topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Formation / first‑money and early‑stage investments; software, AI, hardware, and life‑sciences startups (primarily Silicon Valley and Israel)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-founder and CEO of PandaDoc, a document‑automation SaaS company founded from Quote Roller. Born in Minsk, Belarus, he relocated PandaDoc to Silicon Valley and led growth that included a $1B valuation in 2021; he is also an active angel investor in early‑stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Quote Roller (2011) which evolved into PandaDoc; moved company headquarters to San Francisco and raised multiple rounds including Series A (2015), Series B (2017–2018) and Series C at a $1B valuation in 2021. Serves as PandaDoc CEO and has participated in angel and seed/Series A investments and advisory roles for several startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: SaaS and enterprise software (document automation/e-signature), developer tools and enterprise applications; typically early‑stage to Series A investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Newtopia VC. Former CTO and co‑founder of MURAL (Argentine unicorn) and earlier co‑founder of Three Melons (sold to Playdom/Disney). Active angel investor in Latin America.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and technologist: co‑founded Three Melons (video‑game studio; acquired by Playdom/Disney), co‑founded MURAL and served as CTO as it scaled to a global SaaS company, and transitioned to investing — serving as an angel investor in 30+ startups and as Co‑Founder & General Partner at Newtopia VC focused on early‑stage Latin American tech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to Seed (select Series A follow‑ons) in Latin America; sectors include SaaS, fintech, healthtech, edtech, marketplaces/commerce, web3/crypto, and future‑of‑work solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Matrix focusing on infrastructure and developer tooling investments. Former VP of Product / GM Messaging at Twilio and earlier program manager at Microsoft. Invests with product-led founders across pre-seed to Series A. Based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Product and operator background: program manager at Microsoft (2007–2011), VP of Product / GM Messaging at Twilio (2011–2018), joined Matrix as a partner in 2019 where he leads infrastructure and developer-focused investments. Educated in Human-Computer Interaction and Cognitive Science at Carnegie Mellon University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Infrastructure, developer tooling & APIs, B2B/SaaS; stages: pre-seed through Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: P. Bart Stephens is co‑founder and Managing Partner of Blockchain Capital, a venture firm focused on blockchain and crypto. He is a three‑time founder who previously founded Stephens Investment Management and was a founding investor at Oncology.com; he began his career at E*TRADE. He holds a B.A. in Political Science from Princeton University.
enrichment.career_background: Started his career at E*TRADE, was a founding investor and Head of Corporate & Business Development at Oncology.com, then founded Stephens Investment Management (a nanocap hedge/VC-style firm). In 2013 he co‑founded Blockchain Capital and serves as its Founder & Managing Partner; he has served on boards including Anchorage Digital and Tierion.
enrichment.investment_focus: Blockchain and crypto startups (equity and token investments); multi‑stage investing from seed to growth; infrastructure, DeFi, protocols, marketplaces.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Solana and a senior operator at Solana Labs, where he has led operations, product, and ecosystem growth. Active angel and strategic investor through Solana Ventures, focused on projects building on the Solana blockchain. Educational background includes the Wharton School (University of Pennsylvania).
enrichment.career_background: Raj Gokal co‑founded Solana and has served in senior operational and product roles at Solana Labs and the Solana Foundation. Earlier career experience includes venture investing at General Catalyst, co‑founding Sano (a consumer medical device startup), Director of Product at Omada Health, and an Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Rock Health. He studied economics/finance at the Wharton School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and seed investments in teams building on Solana and the broader Web3/crypto ecosystem (DeFi, NFTs, gaming, infrastructure, on‑chain payments)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder & Managing Partner at Daybreak Ventures. Former partner at Index Ventures who writes the newsletter "Digital Native." Focuses on early-stage consumer and creator-focused technology.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment roles at TPG Growth and The Rise Fund, worked on growth/marketing at Airtable and Calm, joined Index Ventures as a principal/partner (consumer & creator-focused investing), and in 2023–2024 founded Daybreak Ventures to lead an early-stage fund. He is a Knight‑Hennessy scholar with graduate study at Stanford and holds a BA from Dartmouth.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A in consumer technology, creator/creator-led commerce, marketplaces, Gen Z-facing social products, and enterprise tooling that serves consumer behavior

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CEO of Quantstamp, a blockchain security and smart‑contract audit firm. Listed as a Venture Partner / Portfolio Founder at Pioneer Fund. Previously worked as an algorithmic/quantitative software engineer at Tower Research Capital; holds a BS from Cornell University.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Quantstamp and serves as its CEO, leading product and security strategy for smart‑contract audits and Web3 security services. Prior to Quantstamp he worked in algorithmic/high‑frequency trading (Tower Research Capital). Active angel/seed investor and board/advisor for multiple crypto and Web3 startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) investments in Web3/crypto and blockchain security, plus consumer SaaS, gaming, AI and fintech (frequently invests in YC‑backed founders).

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at Third Point Ventures since June 2000. Longtime board director with portfolio experience across semiconductors, enterprise software, security, and data companies. Holds a multi-discipline engineering degree from the University of California, Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Robert Schwartz has served as Managing Partner of Third Point Ventures (the VC arm of Third Point LLC) since June 2000. He previously spent 23 years as President of RF Associates North, a communications semiconductor manufacturer’s representative firm. At Third Point Ventures he leads and sits on boards for multiple investments across enterprise software, networking, security, and semiconductor companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage through growth-stage investments in enterprise and infrastructure software, cloud-native and observability tools, cybersecurity, semiconductors and hardware, data & analytics/AI, fintech and mobility/cleantech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lowercarbon Capital who leads the firm’s work on carbon removal. Previously led Stripe’s carbon removal procurement program and helped build Stripe Climate’s partnerships. Former founder/product designer (Finish) and co‑founder of education startup Volley. Grew up in Boulder, Colorado and is currently based in New York City.
enrichment.career_background: Ryan Orbuch is a Partner at Lowercarbon Capital focusing on carbon removal. Before Lowercarbon he led procurement for Stripe Climate, building partnerships and expert review processes for carbon removal purchases. Earlier in his career he co‑founded the education app Finish (Apple Design Award winner) and the startup Volley, and worked as a product manager and software engineer.
enrichment.investment_focus: Climate tech — carbon removal and emissions reduction; energy and industrial decarbonization; early-stage (Seed–Series A) deep‑tech startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor focused on data infrastructure, developer tooling and AI/ML who was part of Dell Technologies Capital's investment team. After DTC he moved to Unusual Ventures and later joined SignalFire. Holds a BA from Northwestern University.
enrichment.career_background: Worked as a data engineer at Magnetar Capital (~2016–2018), joined Dell Technologies Capital as an investor (2018–2023), then moved to Unusual Ventures (joined 2023) and later became a Principal at SignalFire (joined 2024).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise & cloud infrastructure, data & analytics, developer tools, AI/ML, cybersecurity

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director and CTO at Sutter Hill Ventures. Former senior infrastructure engineer and advisor at Twitter (joined via Bagcheck acquisition) and former Chief Technologist at Yahoo. Early engineer at WebLogic/BEA and co‑founder/CEO of Bagcheck and Gauntlet Systems. Holds an MS in Physics from Northwestern University and a BS from Worcester Polytechnic Institute.
enrichment.career_background: Long‑time technologist turned investor: early server engineer at WebLogic/BEA, co‑founder/CEO of Gauntlet Systems and Bagcheck (acquired by Twitter), later Chief Technologist at Yahoo and senior infrastructure engineer/advisor at Twitter, then joined Sutter Hill Ventures where he invests in and advises infrastructure, developer tooling and cloud companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise infrastructure, observability, developer tools/platforms, databases and cloud security

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner of Manifold Group (Chicago) and an early-stage investor involved in Manifold’s portfolio (~25+ companies while at the firm). Former adjunct instructor at Northwestern University’s Kellogg School (taught digital marketing); currently CEO of Madison, a marketing firm for professional services. Background spans product, growth, venture incubation and founder-facing advisory.
enrichment.career_background: Sean Johnson was a founding partner at Manifold Group, a venture holding company that combines advisory, venture investing and an incubation studio. He has also served as a partner at Founder Equity, taught digital marketing at Northwestern’s Kellogg School, and now leads Madison, focusing on marketing for professional services. During his time at Manifold he helped build an incubation practice and participated in the firm’s early-stage investments and exits.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage investments in enterprise & SMB software, AI/data platforms, fintech and tech-enabled services; plus venture studio/incubation-led company building

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at Lobby Capital and founder/operator with a background scaling consumer and SaaS products. Co‑founder of Evite, former President & CTO of SurveyMonkey, and co‑founder & CEO of Gixo (acquired by Openfit). Currently CEO & co‑founder of HomeBoost and serves on the boards of Redfin and Voltus.
enrichment.career_background: Selina co‑founded Evite, served in senior product/engineering roles at Ticketmaster Europe, and was President & CTO of SurveyMonkey (2009–2016). She co‑founded Gixo (acquired by Openfit), served as Openfit’s Chief Digital Officer, and is currently CEO & co‑founder of HomeBoost. She is a venture partner at Lobby Capital and holds board seats at Redfin and Voltus. She earned a BS in Computer Science from Stanford University and is based in San Francisco.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer & small‑business services; SaaS and marketplaces; early‑stage/seed; climate/home energy

enrichment.personal_bio: Product leader and advisor who helped build Stripe's early product efforts (notably Stripe Connect and Stripe Terminal) and previously held product roles at Google, Twitter, and Yahoo. Founder of High Leverage Labs; teaches product courses, advises startups, and invests as an angel.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced product manager and leader who scaled product teams and developer-facing products across Yahoo, Google, Twitter, and Stripe (credited with early work on Connect and Terminal). Since leaving full-time operator roles he founded High Leverage Labs, runs cohort courses and coaching for PMs, serves as an advisor, and is an active angel investor.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel / early-stage (pre-seed �Series A); fintech & payments, developer platforms/APIs, SaaS and enterprise software, marketplaces, productivity tools

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and managing partner at Volt Capital, a San Francisco–based crypto‑native venture firm that backs early‑stage blockchain and crypto startups. Frequently cited for investments across infrastructure, DeFi, NFTs and developer tooling. University of Michigan School of Engineering alumna and Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital).
enrichment.career_background: Soona Amhaz founded Volt Capital after building Token Daily (later pivoted into On Deck) and working in early‑stage product/operations roles (including at Alation). She leads Volt’s sourcing and investing in pre‑seed to Series A crypto projects and serves as an advisor in the founder community.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage crypto/web3: infrastructure, DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, developer tools and protocol teams

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Blockchain Capital who leads the firm’s research efforts on crypto and blockchain investments. CFA charterholder with a B.A. in Business Economics from UC Santa Barbara. Frequently quoted in industry press and holds board/advisor roles in portfolio companies.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Blockchain Capital in February 2017 and was promoted to partner; leads the firm’s research and investment analysis across tokens and equity. Previously Vice President, Equity Research at Needham & Company (authored early Wall Street blockchain research) and worked at ETF.com. Holds the CFA charter and a BA in Business Economics from UC Santa Barbara. Serves on/has served on boards or as an advisor to portfolio companies (e.g., Blocknative, Radar/Radar Relay).
enrichment.investment_focus: Web3 / crypto (protocols, infrastructure), decentralized & centralized finance, crypto-native consumer and gaming; invests both in tokens and equity across seed to growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Crypto who has led the firm’s crypto investments since joining Bain in 2016. Interests span protocol infrastructure (L1s, scaling, privacy) and end-user applications (DeFi, DAOs, games). Previously an early employee at Turbonomic (acquired by IBM).
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bain Capital in 2016 and has led the firm’s crypto investing efforts, co‑leading the Bain Capital Crypto platform. Prior to Bain he was an early employee at Turbonomic where he built the Strategy & Operations team; earlier worked in IBM corporate strategy. He holds a degree in economics from Clark University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Protocols and infrastructure (L1s, scaling, privacy/ZK), middleware and tooling, DeFi primitives, DAO/governance and crypto-native consumer/enterprise applications; invests across seed through growth stages.

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor who joined CrunchFund as a partner in 2016 to lead seed and early-stage investments. Former Director of Global Programming at TechCrunch and Director of Programming at Y Combinator; later served as Chief of Staff to Cloudflare’s CEO & COO. Publicly known to champion founder storytelling and early-stage founder support.
enrichment.career_background: Susan Hobbs has held senior operating and programming roles at TechCrunch (Director of Global Programming, ~2011–2015) and Y Combinator (Director of Programming, ~2015–2016). She joined CrunchFund as a partner in 2016 to lead seed-stage investments and brand-building, and later served as Chief of Staff to the CEO & COO at Cloudflare (from 2018). She studied at San Diego State University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage venture; founder storytelling/PR support; startup programming and community building

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and CTO of Cresta (enterprise conversational AI). Early member of OpenAI (member of technical staff) and trained in AI research at Stanford and Tsinghua. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area and active as an angel investor / micro‑fund sponsor.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder & CTO of Cresta (since 2017), previously a member of technical staff at OpenAI (circa 2016–2017) and earlier engineering/research roles (Dropbox, DJI). Began angel investing around 2022 and has filed investment vehicles (Form D for a Tim Shi micro‑AI investment entity in 2023).
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise AI; generative AI/LLM applications; early‑stage (seed/pre‑seed) investments

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Pioneer Fund based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Former founder of Graffiti Labs and Fearless (VR). Focuses on investing in YC‑ecosystem startups across seed through Series B, particularly in consumer internet, AI, e‑commerce, biotech and IoT.
enrichment.career_background: Tim Suzman is a founder‑operator turned investor. He co‑founded Graffiti Labs (2007) and founded Fearless (virtual‑reality company), was a partner at an alumni/seed fund, and has served as a General/Managing Partner at Pioneer Fund since 2018. At Pioneer he focuses on sourcing and leading investments into YC‑affiliated startups at seed through Series A/B.
enrichment.investment_focus: YC‑ecosystem startups; stages: Seed through Series B (seed, Series A, Series B); sector focus: consumer internet, AI, e‑commerce, biotech/consumer health, IoT.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Burnt Island Ventures, a specialist early-stage fund for water technology. Over a decade of experience in the water sector; formerly VP Programming at Imagine H2O and lead author on the first CDP Water Disclosure Report (2010). Holds an MA from the University of Edinburgh and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Tom founded Burnt Island Ventures in 2020 to back early-stage water entrepreneurs and closed a ~$30M first fund (announced 2022). He previously ran programming at Imagine H2O (building its accelerator portfolio), worked in sustainability consulting (ERM) and held strategy/ops roles at water/energy startups. Education: MA (University of Edinburgh) and MBA (Harvard Business School).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in water and climate technologies — treatment, monitoring, distribution, infrastructure, and software for utilities/O&M.

enrichment.personal_bio: Cameroonian-born entrepreneur and angel investor. Founder of Afrostream and co‑founder/CEO of several startups; active investor in early-stage fintech and web3 companies. Listed as a partner / LP with Orange Fund (Orange DAO) and participates in YC-related networks.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Afrostream (a streaming service for African and diaspora content) and has held roles as entrepreneur‑in‑residence and advisor at Y Combinator. Since 2019–2022 he has been active as an angel/seed investor across fintech, web3 and marketplace startups and is listed as a partner/LP with Orange Fund (Orange DAO). He has also been involved in startup mentoring, university lecturing and cultural/entertainment production.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage investments in Web3/crypto, fintech/payments, and media/streaming (global with interest in African markets)

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Partner at Blacktop Capital and a senior engineering leader currently listed as VP of Engineering at Fauna. Experienced software engineer and early‑stage investor with leadership roles at Microsoft, Amazon/AWS and Riot Games. Holds a BS in Computer Science (Biola University), an MS in Computer Science (University of Washington) and an MBA (UC Berkeley Haas).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and founding partner of Blacktop Capital (seed VC). Earlier founded Axiem Technologies and held senior engineering and management roles at Microsoft, Amazon (General Manager, AWS CodePipeline/CodeDeploy), and Riot Games (infrastructure). Currently listed on Fauna’s leadership page as VP of Engineering, leading development of distributed database systems.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / pre‑seed software startups (enterprise SaaS, cloud infrastructure & developer tooling, data/AI, games); primarily Western US geography

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and President of StartUp Health, a global community and investor network for digital health and biotech entrepreneurs. Tech entrepreneur since the mid‑1990s; co‑hosts StartUp Health NOW and has written for outlets including Forbes. Focused on long‑term, mission‑driven health innovation.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded StartUp Health in 2011 and serves as President and co‑founder, leading its global Health Transformer community and investment activities. Prior to StartUp Health he co‑founded OrganizedWisdom and held product/marketing roles in internet companies since the mid‑1990s; he is a Boston University alumnus and frequent speaker on health innovation.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital health, healthtech and biotech startups; primarily early‑stage (seed through Series A); mission‑driven/global health innovation

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on Redpoint’s early-stage team. Previously worked in transaction advisory at Ernst & Young and as a consultant at Boston Consulting Group. Joined Redpoint in 2020 and has led investments across SaaS, consumer and crypto; holds an MBA from Wharton and a BA from Middlebury College. Grew up in India and has lived in Hong Kong and China before settling in the U.S.; fosters senior dogs in her free time.
enrichment.career_background: Started in transaction advisory at Ernst & Young, then worked at Boston Consulting Group on strategy and pricing. Joined venture capital via Primary Venture Partners before joining Redpoint in 2020; promoted to Principal in 2021 and to Partner in 2024. At Redpoint she focuses on early-stage (seed–Series A) investments across SaaS, fintech, consumer and crypto.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (Seed–Series A) startups in SaaS (vertical & AI), fintech/embedded finance, healthcare, Web3/crypto and consumer marketplaces/logistics.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Framework Ventures, a San Francisco–based crypto‑native venture firm. Formerly co‑founder of Hashletes and BizOps at Netflix; earlier a management consultant at Monitor Deloitte. Active commentator and investor in DeFi, token economics, and web3 protocols.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Framework Ventures in 2019 to invest in and build crypto protocols. Prior to Framework he co‑founded Hashletes (2018–2019), worked in BizOps at Netflix (2015–2018, including Tokyo), and began his career as a management consultant at Monitor Deloitte (2013–2015). He studied econometrics/quantitative economics at the University of Southern California.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage crypto and Web3 (DeFi, protocol tokens, blockchain infrastructure, web3 gaming, tokenized networks and governance)

enrichment.personal_bio: Attorney and investor; formerly Twitter’s head of legal, policy and trust, and a co‑founder of the #ANGELS investment collective. Serves on boards and trustees (including Mercy Corps and NYU Law School). Educated at Cornell (BS) and NYU School of Law (JD).
interests: Increasing women’s ownership on cap tables / diverse founders
enrichment.career_background: Vijaya Gadde earned a B.S. from Cornell and a J.D. from NYU Law. She spent nearly a decade at Wilson Sonsini, was senior director of legal at Juniper Networks, joined Twitter in 2011 and rose to lead legal, policy and trust. She co‑founded #ANGELS (2015) and has served on boards including Mercy Corps and NYU Law School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early‑stage investments in technology startups (consumer internet, developer tools, fintech, health, marketplaces); increasing founder diversity and women on cap tables.

enrichment.personal_bio: Physician‑scientist and investor focused on healthcare and life‑sciences innovation. Previously a venture partner at Molten Ventures (fka Draper Esprit), he has led and advised multiple digital health, biotech and diagnostic investments and co‑founded Recode Ventures. Trained in medicine in India with postgraduate research at Oxford and Imperial College London.
interests: AI/ML in healthcare and medical imaging
enrichment.career_background: Trained as a clinician‑scientist (MBBS; postgraduate research at University of Oxford and Imperial College London), Vishal spent 15+ years in venture roles including Atlas Venture, Oxford Science Enterprises and as a venture partner at Molten Ventures (formerly DFJ/Draper Esprit). He has served on numerous public and private boards in healthtech and biotech and co‑founded Recode Ventures in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage healthtech and biotech (digital therapeutics, diagnostics), AI/ML and computational biology applied to healthcare, genomics and platform therapeutics

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at JAZZ Venture Partners; venture capitalist, entrepreneur and futurist focused on human performance, neuroscience and life‑science technologies. Serves on multiple portfolio boards and supports companies from seed through growth stages. Author of The Neuro Revolution and founder of NeuroInsights and the Neurotechnology Industry Organization.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner of JAZZ Venture Partners (founded 2015). Previously founded NeuroInsights (neurotech market research/investment advisory), created the NeuroInsights Neurotech Index, and founded the Neurotechnology Industry Organization to advocate for the field. Author of The Neuro Revolution; holds degrees from UCLA in evolutionary biology, environmental science and economic geography.
enrichment.investment_focus: Human performance, neurotechnology and digital therapeutics; enterprise and consumer wellness; early and growth-stage venture investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Madrona based in Palo Alto; joined Madrona in 2022. Focuses on enterprise software, cloud infrastructure, data tools, intelligent applications (AI) and fintech, helping founders scale after product‑market fit. Previously worked across growth-stage and early-stage investing and writes on AI and intelligent applications.
enrichment.career_background: Vivek helped launch the venture arm of Steadfast Capital (leading investments in several high-growth software and fintech companies), was a Principal at Redpoint Ventures for ~5 years, and began his career in technology investment banking at Goldman Sachs. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Ivey Business School at Western University and joined Madrona as a Partner in 2022.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed through acceleration (Series A–C); enterprise software, cloud infrastructure, data & infrastructure, intelligent applications (AI), and fintech

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Mythos Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on prosocial AI and "AGI‑proof" companies. Previously co‑led AGI deployment strategy and worked in strategic communications at DeepMind, and led growth at Upstart. Yale University graduate.
enrichment.career_background: Vishal Maini is the founder and managing partner of Mythos Ventures (founded 2023), which writes pre-seed and seed checks into AI‑native, prosocial technologies. Prior to Mythos he held growth roles at Upstart and served in strategic communications and as co‑lead for AGI deployment strategy at DeepMind. He studied at Yale University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage startups focused on AI/ML (AGI‑proof companies), prosocial technologies, robotics/automation, and frontier biotech.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of XIFAQ, a startup incubator and innovation hub launched in 2017. Serial entrepreneur and early-stage angel investor based in Atlanta, Georgia, with experience mentoring and advising founders across deep-tech and frontier sectors.
enrichment.career_background: Affaque Ahmed founded XIFAQ in 2017 after over 15 years building companies across automobile, IT, food and tech sectors. He runs XIFAQ as an incubator/co‑work space and mentors founders, offering acceleration, go‑to‑market and fundraising support while also participating in angel investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage startups (incubation/acceleration); deep‑tech (AI, robotics, space‑tech), climate tech; Web3 and frontier technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Bryan Kim ("BK") is a partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) who invests primarily in consumer and app‑layer AI. He focuses on how AI reshapes productivity, creation, consumer health, and social experiences. Previously he held leadership roles at Snap and was CFO at Bungalow; he was also a founding GP at operator-led seed fund Uncommon Projects. He holds a BA from Carleton College and an MBA from Columbia Business School.
enrichment.career_background: Started in investment banking at Credit Suisse, moved into product/growth and finance leadership at Snap during its hyper-growth and IPO, served as CFO of Bungalow, was a founding general partner at Uncommon Projects, and joined Andreessen Horowitz as a partner (investing in consumer & app-layer AI).
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer and app-layer AI; early-stage consumer apps (seed through Series A/B), creator tools, social/connection products, and consumer health

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Partner at GGW Ventures and founder/CEO of Go Global World. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, he builds startup communities, mentors founders, and invests in software startups. Background includes roles at GSD Venture Studios and Philip Morris International.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and operator now focused on connecting founders and investors: founder & CEO of Go Global World (a platform and community for startups and VCs), managing partner at GGW Ventures (the venture arm), former Partner & VP of Global Business Intelligence at GSD Venture Studios, and previously held global roles at Philip Morris International; adjunct lecturer and mentor at business schools (e.g., Skolkovo).
enrichment.investment_focus: Software companies (late seed / Series A), post-revenue (targeting teams with traction and ~$1M+ ARR); typical check ~ $300K; prefers US-incorporated startups.

enrichment.firm_name: Black Ops Ventures (Black Operator Ventures, LLC)
enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing/general partner at Black Ops Ventures, a seed fund that backs Black‑led tech startups. Founder & CEO of Pilotly, a market‑research platform for media and content, and co‑founder of Transparent Collective. Serial entrepreneur with prior ventures including Ubi Video and GroupFlix; holds a BSE in Electrical Engineering from the University of Michigan.
enrichment.career_background: James Norman is a serial founder turned investor. He founded early media/OTT companies (Ubi Video, GroupFlix), later launched Pilotly (consumer insights for content) and co‑founded Transparent Collective to support underrepresented founders. In 2020–2021 he co‑founded Black Operator Ventures (Black Ops) to lead seed investments in Black‑led technology companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed‑stage investments in Black‑led tech startups (focus includes media/OTT, consumer tech, fintech and enterprise software)

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner on a16z’s Bio + Health team who leads investments in companies modernizing healthcare access, payment, and delivery. Previously co‑founder and Chief Product Officer at Kyruus; earlier product and engineering roles at Generation Health, Knome, and Endeca. Holds an MS in genomics (Harvard‑MIT HST) and an MBA (MIT Sloan).
interests: AI/ML applied to clinical and administrative workflows
enrichment.career_background: Julie Yoo is a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) focusing on Bio + Health investments. She co‑founded Kyruus and served as its Chief Product Officer, scaling the company’s provider matching platform; prior roles include VP of Product at Generation Health, Product Manager at Knome, and early software engineer at Endeca. She holds degrees from MIT and Harvard‑MIT HST and is a World Economic Forum Young Global Leader.
enrichment.investment_focus: Healthcare technology (access, payment, and delivery); healthtech infrastructure and enterprise clinical/admin tools; AI/ML for healthcare workflows. Stages: Seed through Series B.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Singular based in London with a background in scaling consumer and fintech businesses. Former senior leader at Deliveroo and NerdWallet; joined Papier's board after Singular led its Series C.
enrichment.career_background: Worked at Bain & Company early in her career, then held product and GM roles at NerdWallet (insurance), moved to Deliveroo as Senior Director of Strategy & Transformation, and joined Singular as a Partner (London) where she focuses on supporting high-growth consumer and software companies. Joined the board of Papier following Singular's Series C investment.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage European technology: consumer & marketplaces, B2B/SaaS, fintech/insurance (Seed to Series A/B)

enrichment.personal_bio: Peter H. Diamandis is an American entrepreneur, physician and engineer. He is a co‑founder/partner at BOLD Capital Partners and the founder and executive chairman of the XPRIZE Foundation. He has co‑founded or helped start 20+ companies across space, longevity and exponential technologies.
enrichment.career_background: Diamandis trained as an engineer and physician (degrees from MIT and an M.D. from Harvard Medical School). He founded the XPRIZE Foundation and co‑founded Singularity University and BOLD Capital Partners, and has co‑founded and led multiple companies in space, health and longevity; he focuses on building and funding ventures that leverage exponential technologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage and growth investments in exponential technologies: longevity/biotech, healthtech, AI/software, space/aerospace and frontier physical technologies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Former Partner at Index Ventures (joined 2018), Sarah Cannon focused on productivity, future-of-work and enterprise software investing. She led or supported Index investments in companies such as Notion, Instabase and Lightning AI and served as a board observer at Slack. Prior to venture she worked at CapitalG and as a policy advisor at the White House.
enrichment.career_background: Sarah Cannon was a Partner at Index Ventures (2018–2022). Before Index she was a principal at CapitalG (Alphabet’s growth fund) and earlier served as a policy advisor on the National Economic Council in the Obama administration. Her early career included McKinsey and a Fulbright; she holds a BA from Yale and graduate degrees from Harvard (MPA and MBA).
enrichment.investment_focus: Early and growth-stage investments in productivity/collaboration, future-of-work platforms, enterprise software, developer tools and AI

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner on the a16z Growth investing team focused on AI and enterprise technology. Previously a vice president at TA Associates and an early-stage investor at DCM Ventures and Radicle Impact; began her career at BCG and Morgan Stanley. Holds a BA in Economics from Harvard and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
interests: Generative AI / AI for the enterprise
enrichment.career_background: Sarah Wang is a General Partner on Andreessen Horowitz's Growth team, where she leads and partners with growth-stage enterprise and AI companies. Prior to a16z she was VP at TA Associates (served on the ZoomInfo board), and earlier worked in venture at DCM Ventures and Radicle Impact and in consulting and capital markets at BCG and Morgan Stanley. She holds a BA from Harvard and an MBA from Stanford GSB.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI and enterprise technology; growth-stage investments across enterprise, fintech, consumer internet, crypto/web3, and bio+healthcare

enrichment.personal_bio: Entrepreneur and early-stage angel investor. Co‑founder of Eventjoy (YC W14), which was acquired by Ticketmaster, and co‑founder of the Todd & Rahul angel fund with Rahul Vohra. Active investor in many startups and co‑founder of the crypto fund Curated.
enrichment.career_background: Todd Goldberg is a San Francisco–area entrepreneur and angel investor. He co‑founded Eventjoy (acquired by Ticketmaster), founded Mailjoy, co‑founded the cryptonative fund Curated, and invests through Todd & Rahul's Angel Fund alongside Rahul Vohra. He focuses on helping founders with product, distribution and fundraising.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed (occasionally post-seed/Series A); generalist across SaaS, productivity, creator tools, health & wellness and business infrastructure. Typical check size ~$300k–$500k.

enrichment.personal_bio: Director / Head of Corporate Development & Ventures at Coinbase. Leads M&A and strategic investments for Coinbase’s corporate and Ventures activity. Previously a product manager at LinkedIn and worked in investment banking at Deutsche Bank. Educated at Santa Clara University.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Coinbase’s corporate development & ventures function as an early hire and now leads corporate development, acquisitions, and strategic investments for the company. Prior roles include product management at LinkedIn and investment banking at Deutsche Bank. Serves on nonprofit boards and participates in the crypto startup ecosystem.
enrichment.investment_focus: Crypto / Web3, token infrastructure, developer platforms, FinTech; primarily early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CTO of Meaningful (a growth & product studio); former lead engineer at Akorda and research engineer at AiFi. Based in Miami and San Francisco; serves as a limited partner/partner at 500 LatAm and participates as an angel/advisor to early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Alberto Sadde is a software engineer and entrepreneur who co‑founded Meaningful (growth, SEO, martech, low-code). He previously worked on compiler research at Oxford, engineering at BAE Systems, was an early engineer at AiFi, and served as lead engineer/tech lead at Akorda. He is active as a fractional CTO, startup advisor, and a limited partner/partner with 500 LatAm.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (seed to Series A) Latin America startups; developer tools, SaaS, and growth/marketing technology

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Hometeam Ventures, a seed/early-stage fund focused on construction and housing technology. Former co‑founder and COO of New Story, where she led operations on large-scale affordable housing and early 3D‑printed home projects. Raised an ~$18M fund to back startups that cut housing costs and improve the built environment.
enrichment.career_background: After Teach For America and operations work at McMaster‑Carr, Lafci co‑founded New Story (YC S15) and served as COO, leading field operations, R&D pilots and large fundraising efforts for global affordable housing. In 2021 she launched Hometeam Ventures to invest in startups that reduce cost, speed construction, and improve quality across the construction value chain.
enrichment.investment_focus: Construction & housing technology; seed to early growth stages; industrialized construction (3D printing, modular), BIM/digital twins, project & jobsite management, supply‑chain and construction finance.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and product lead at Efficient App (based in Austin, TX) and operator of the Efficient VC angel vehicle. Active angel investor focused on product, automation, and efficiency in B2B SaaS. Associated with Orange Fund / Orange DAO and participates in early-stage investments.
enrichment.career_background: Alex Bass founded Efficient App (formerly CyberBytes) and serves as Founder & Head of Product. He began angel investing publicly in 2021 through Efficient VC and has built a portfolio of early-stage investments, advising on product and operations for founders. He is based in Austin, Texas and is active in both SaaS and crypto communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed/seed) investments in Web3/Crypto and FinTech; B2B SaaS focused on efficiency/productivity; founder-led, product-first startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Partner at NGC Ventures focused on early-stage web3 and blockchain infrastructure. Previously an investment research analyst at Goldman Sachs in Singapore and at the Trans-Pacific Technology Fund. Holds an MBA from UC Berkeley (Haas) and a bachelor's in finance from National Taiwan University. Interests include infrastructure, DeFi and the metaverse.
enrichment.career_background: Joined NGC Ventures' investment team and is listed as a Venture Partner. Earlier roles include investment research analyst at Goldman Sachs (Singapore) and analyst at Trans-Pacific Technology Fund. Education: MBA, UC Berkeley (Haas); BBA/Bachelor's in Finance, National Taiwan University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage web3 and blockchain infrastructure, DeFi, metaverse

enrichment.personal_bio: Andy Volk is a Silicon Valley product and ecosystem leader and an active early-stage investor focused on African startups. He is a Founding Limited Partner & Global Advisor at Microtraction and has led Google’s developer/startup ecosystem work for Sub‑Saharan Africa. He publishes the Africa Notes newsletter and has made 30+ angel investments and LP commitments into Africa‑focused funds.
enrichment.career_background: Andy Volk has worked across product, developer relations, and ecosystem roles in Silicon Valley and Africa. His background includes leadership roles at Google (developer & startup ecosystem for Sub‑Saharan Africa), prior product/engineering work and startups (including Live365 and Downtempo), and advisory/LP roles at funds such as Microtraction and Future.Africa. He also runs an AngelList syndicate focused on African deal flow.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed African technology startups (fintech, SaaS, healthtech, crypto/Web3); early-stage check sizes in the $100K range; community & developer ecosystem support

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture Analyst at Wave Financial focused on digital-asset and Web3 investing. Previously an investment consultant at Aves Lair and compliance consultant at Aspect Advisors; holds Series 7, 24, and 63 licenses and a BA in Political Science & Asian Studies from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Aric Chang is a Venture Analyst at Wave Financial. His background includes roles as an investment consultant (Aves Lair) and compliance consultant (Aspect Advisors); he holds multiple FINRA licenses (Series 7, 24, 63) and a BA from UC Berkeley. He has written about rollups, Celestia, and NFT use-cases, indicating a focus on crypto infrastructure and digital-asset applications.
enrichment.investment_focus: Digital assets / crypto (Web3), DeFi, NFTs and blockchain infrastructure; early-stage (seed) and fintech investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding/Managing Partner at Blacktop Capital (since 2016). Former owner of Brasher's Auto Auctions and member of ServNet Auction Group leadership. Holds a BS from Brigham Young University and an Executive/EMBA from UC Berkeley Haas. Based in the Rocklin/Sacramento, California area.
enrichment.career_background: Ben Brasher co‑founded Blacktop Capital in 2016 and serves as a founding partner. Prior to venture investing he owned and operated Brasher's Auto Auctions (2004–2016), served on the ServNet Auction Group executive team, and held roles at Auction Management Services. He studied Business Management at Brigham Young University and completed an executive MBA at UC Berkeley Haas.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed / early-stage investments with a preference for software over hardware; targets post-revenue or growing software companies across AI/ML, consumer internet, enterprise SaaS, fintech and transportation/mobility.

enrichment.personal_bio: Ben McCann is an investor and advisor at C3 Ventures and a technologist. He co‑founded Connectifier (CTO), which was acquired by LinkedIn, and later worked on hire‑matching at LinkedIn. He holds a B.S. in Computer Science and an MBA from Carnegie Mellon University.
enrichment.career_background: Ben co‑founded Connectifier and served as its CTO; Connectifier was acquired by LinkedIn in 2016. After the acquisition he worked on hire‑matching products at LinkedIn. Earlier he was a software engineer at Google. He is currently an investor and advisor at C3 Ventures and is active in open‑source developer communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early‑stage investments in enterprise SaaS, healthcare/healthtech, space tech, green energy, autonomous transportation and consumer startups.

enrichment.personal_bio: PhD-trained human geneticist (Broad/Harvard) who contributed to gnomAD and transcript-expression-aware variant annotation. Worked in industry as a human genetics data scientist (Maze Therapeutics) and served as a Senior Associate at Third Rock Ventures focused on company creation. More recently listed as Head of Genetics and Program Team Lead at Marea Therapeutics.
enrichment.career_background: Beryl Cummings earned a PhD in human/medical genetics (Broad Institute/Harvard), co-authored papers on variant interpretation and gnomAD, and transitioned to industry roles at Maze Therapeutics. She joined Third Rock Ventures as a Senior Associate involved in building new biotech companies and later took an industry role as Head of Genetics and Program Team Lead at Marea Therapeutics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Applying human genetics and transcriptomics to create early-stage biotechnology companies and rare-disease therapeutics

enrichment.personal_bio: Co-CEO of Mission North with 25+ years in strategic communications advising technology companies. Listed as an LP/partner with MKT1 Capital on public profiles (2021–2024). Publishes and comments on technology, media and communications topics.
enrichment.career_background: Co-CEO and former President & Partner at Mission North (formerly Bateman Group), where he leads corporate communications, go-to-market and enterprise practice work; earlier roles include VP of Marketing at a media startup and Special Assistant/Deputy Policy Advisor to the Mayor of San Francisco. Public-profile listings show he served as an LP/partner at MKT1 Capital (listed 2021–2024). He graduated from St. Lawrence University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed to Series A B2B startups (MarTech, enterprise software) with hands-on go-to-market and marketing support; typical check sizes ~$100k–$300k.

enrichment.personal_bio: Blake Masters is an American venture capitalist and author best known for co‑writing Zero to One with Peter Thiel. He served as chief operating officer of Thiel Capital and president of the Thiel Foundation before resigning in 2022 to run for the U.S. Senate in Arizona. He has co‑founded Judicata and held board roles at public companies such as PSQ Holdings (PublicSquare).
enrichment.career_background: Masters earned a B.A. and a J.D. from Stanford University. He posted detailed notes from Peter Thiel’s Stanford class that became the basis for the bestseller Zero to One (2014), co‑founded legal research startup Judicata, and later worked as COO of Thiel Capital and president of the Thiel Foundation. He resigned from Thiel organizations in March 2022 to run for U.S. Senate (Arizona) and subsequently has served on several public company boards.
enrichment.investment_focus: Technology startups (software), legaltech, crypto and policy‑adjacent investments

enrichment.personal_bio: CEO and co‑founder of New Story and co‑founder/advisor at Hometeam Ventures. Focuses on construction and housing innovation and impact-driven solutions to affordable housing. Y Combinator alum and Forbes 30 Under 30 recognized entrepreneur.
interests: AEC digitization and sustainable building materials
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded New Story in 2014 and serves as its CEO, leading market‑based solutions for affordable housing and pioneering projects such as 3D‑printed homes. Co‑founded Hometeam Ventures (2020/2021) to invest in early‑stage construction and housing startups; has served on advisory boards including DocuSign Impact and on the board of Garden City Companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed/Series A) investments in construction and housing technology, AEC software and hardware, and double‑bottom‑line startups that reduce cost, increase speed, and improve quality in the built environment.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founding Principal at Prefix Capital based in San Francisco. Focuses on early-stage, deep‑tech investments and works on diligence, portfolio support and firm operations. Previously an associate at 415 Investments and holds a BS in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford University.
enrichment.career_background: Calvin Ling co‑founded and served as a principal at Prefix Capital (an early‑stage deep‑tech VC). He previously worked as an associate at 415 Investments, held operations/strategic roles including an internship at Honda Silicon Valley Lab, has served as a board observer for portfolio companies (e.g., SwiftComply), and earned a BS in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early‑stage; deep‑tech/foundational technologies across software, information security, AI/ML, biotech, semiconductors, and hardware.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and CEO of Loyal (Cellular Longevity), a clinical‑stage company developing drugs to extend dogs' healthy lifespan. Previously Chief of Staff and Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at The Longevity Fund; trained in neuroscience and health economics (University of Texas; DPhil studies at Oxford). Based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Served as Chief of Staff and Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at The Longevity Fund before founding Loyal (aka Cellular Longevity) in 2019/2020, where she is CEO. Academic and research background includes neuroscience (BSc, University of Texas at Austin), DPhil studies at University of Oxford (health economics of gene therapy), and research roles at Sanford Burnham Prebys and scientific consulting at Oisín Biotechnologies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage longevity and aging therapeutics; seed–Series A biotech and life‑science companies; translational therapeutics and veterinary applications.

enrichment.personal_bio: Venture investor who worked at Index Ventures (joined from GitHub) and has focused on community-led products and crypto. Previously held roles in strategic finance and business operations at GitHub and worked in finance at Hellman & Friedman and Morgan Stanley. Educated at Georgetown University (B.S., Foreign Service).
enrichment.career_background: Chris began his career in investment banking at Morgan Stanley, moved to Hellman & Friedman in private equity, then joined GitHub (Director, Strategic Finance & Business Operations) where he helped scale operations and supported the Microsoft acquisition. He joined Index Ventures (Principal/Partner, 2018–2022), sponsoring investments in community-focused products and crypto, and later joined Haun Ventures as a partner focused on crypto investing.
enrichment.investment_focus: Community-led consumer products, developer tools/open source, crypto/Web3 infrastructure, enterprise SaaS (bottoms-up growth)
